title: fgc-9
body:
the [b]FGC-9[/b] (or its full name: Fuck Gun Control) is an 9x19mm chambered short-barreled carbine that is not a [[submachine gun]] or a machine pistol, because it fires [u]semi-automatic only[/u] rather selective-fire, despite having the options of equipping the [[gun]] with a longer barrel or stock.

The FGC-9 be recognized by Its upper and receiver combined to make its short profile, while the metal barrel is usually long enough to stick out, and its [[3d printer|3D-printed]] parts can be of any colors rather only black.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: FGC-9":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FGC-9
* "Def Cad: FGC-9":https://defcad.com/library/fgc-9-mk2-9mm-pistol/

title: m.d._geist
body:
[b]M.D. Geist[/b] ([i]"Sokihei M.D. Gaisuto"[/i], literally [i]"Demon-Garbed Soldier M.D. Geist"[/i]) is a 1986 40-minute post-apocalyptic [[science fiction]] [[cyberpunk]] OVA directed by [[Oohata Kouichi]]. Famous for its powerful soundtrack, over the top action and violence, intricate mechanical design by Oohata, multiple animation errors and bizarre story, M.D. Geist is generally seen as a bad production, but has also become somewhat of a cult classic.

In the future, the war-torn planet of Jerra has been locked in a war between the Earth government loyalists and the Nexrum corporation for decades. To counter Nexrum's advanced weapons, the Earth government developed one-man armies, the Most Dangerous Soldiers. However they proved to be far too strong, and most eventually lost their minds and went on rampage. Being one of the surviving Most Dangerous Soldiers, [[MDS-02 GEIST]] was put into stasis inside a satellite in Jerra's orbit. Years later, the satellite prison crashes on the desolate planet and Geist reawakens. He recovers a Powered Suit, battles with bandits and units of the Nexrum military and eventually joins a group of Earth army commandos in a mission to deactivate the secret doomsday weapon on Jerra: a self-replicating robot swarm known as "Death Force". However, there's more than meets the eye to Geist.

A sequel OVA, "M.D. Geist II: Death Force", was made a decade later, alongside a comic book prequel. The 1986 OVA has also received a Director's Cut edition, which fixes the animation errors, adds more blood and some new footage.

title: sunflower
body:
A native flowering plant from the Americas.  The common sunflower is most recognizable by their single large yellow apical "flower," with an initially greenish center that turns yellow-brown and then blackish as it matures.  They typically grow to heights of around 3 meters (10 feet) with record plants reach heights of 9+ meters (30+ feet). Sunflowers are grown for various purposes such as for food, cooking oil, livestock feed, and decoration. 

Domestic sunflowers come in a variety of colors beyond the common yellow, with colors such as cream color, gold, orange, red, mahogany, and chocolate brown.  While the common types only feature a singular apical flower (one that grows at the tip of the central stem), there are also varieties that grow many additional branching flowers.  The large blooms of the sunflower while commonly called a "flower" is in fact a "flower head," a structure composed of many smaller flowers (florets) that together appear as one single flower.

Sunflowers and their relatives are heliotropic while they're developing, meaning that the plants will turn following the direction of the sun during the day.  As they get closer to maturing, the plant stiffen and lose it's ability to track the sun. Due to their heliotropic nature, most plants will mature locked facing toward the East, the direction of the rising sun.

h4. Examples

* !post #6797029

h4. See also

* [[Sunflower seed]]
* [[Tag group:flowers]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Common Sunflower":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_sunflower]

title: tyrannosaurus_rex
body:
A large theropod carnivorous [[dinosaur]]. Often referred to as "T-Rex" for short, from the type specimen's scientific name [i]Tyrannosaurus rex[/i].

While there are at least five other species of [i]Tyrannosaurus[/i] known to science, the type specimen [i]T-Rex[/i] is arguably the most popular species of non-avian dinosaur, stemming from the discovery of several complete fossil specimens, along with its depictions in media as an apex predator. Particularly in [[Jurassic Park]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7912065

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tyrannosaurus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyrannosaurus

title: payphone
body:
A public [[phone]], with payment by inserting money (usually coins). Often seen furnished inside [[phone booth]]s and seen alongside [[phone book]]s.

Traditional Japanese payphones are fat and green and often include a card reader in addition to a typical coin slot.

Don't use this tag where a [[phone booth]] is visible, but the payphone inside is not. Do use it instead of phone booth for free-standing or wall-mounted payphones without any sort of enclosure.

h4. Examples

* !post #3832440
* !post #7748417

h4. See also

* [[telephone card (medium)|]]
* [[phone booth]]
* [[phone book]]

title: square_4koma
body:
A [[4koma]] with a 2×2 format (2 rows and 2 columns).

The close proximity of panels causes ambiguity in reading order, making [[numbered panels]] or directional arrows much more common.

h4. Examples

* !post #7408591

h4. See also

* [[4koma]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

title: phone_booth
body:
A small structure furnished with a [[payphone]] (and often a [[phone book]]) and designed for making calls. Usually the booth has a door to provide privacy and a window.  This tag should ideally be used for glassed-in enclosures with a door, but at minimum should have at least privacy dividers and/or a weatherproof roof.  Don't use this for open-air free-standing or plain wall-mounted [[payphone]]s.

Common designs include the traditional British red multi-paned phone booths, and the more modern looking aluminum and glass boxes common in Japan and elsewhere.

These usually feature the standard fat green Japanese payphones.

h4. Examples

* !post #838703
* !post #3488476

h4. See also

* [[payphone]]
* [[phone book]]

title: booth_seating
body:
A type of [[restaurant]] seating consisting of fixed, usually padded, bench-like seats on either side of each table. Multiple booths may be lined up such that patrons are seated back-to-back.

For other structures often called "booths", see [[phone booth]] and [[food stand]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6330427

title: linton_(project_moon)
body:
The husband of [[Catherine_(project_moon)|]] and based on Edgar Linton from Wuthering Heights, serving as an antagonist in Canto VI of [[Limbus Company]].

He has [[pale skin]] and [[short hair|short]], [[messy hair|messy]], [[blonde hair]], and is seen with [[bags under eyes|bags under his]] [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[black coat]] over a [[black vest]] and [[white shirt]] with a [[black necktie]] along with [[black pants|black]] [[dress pants]] and [[black footwear|matching]] [[dress shoes]].

title: farmwatch_(e.g.o)
body:
The personal e.g.o of [spoiler] [[Dongrang (project moon)|Dongrang]].[/spoiler]

Its clothing consists of a [[white hanbok]] over a [[brown coat]] with a [[rice hat]], [[brown gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], all of which are [[dirty clothes|soiled]]. It also tends to give the wearer [[horns]], and the weapon used with it is a [[scythe]].

title: drifting_fox
body:
An [[list_of_project_moon_characters|abnormality]] first appearing in [[Limbus Company]] whom the [[E.G.O (project moon)|E.G.O]] of [[Sunshower (e.g.o)|]] is derived from.

It resembles an [[oversized animal|oversized]] [[fox]] with [[umbrella|umbrellas]], including [[broken umbrella|broken ones]], lodged inside of its body. It also uses one as a [[weapon]], which it holds with its [[weapon in mouth|mouth]].

title: weapon_in_mouth
body: A character holding a [[weapon]] inside their mouth, usually with their [[teeth]].

title: every_catherine_(project_moon)
body:
A [[spoilers|spoiler]] character from Canto VI of [[Limbus Company]].

She is a [[ghost]]-like apparition of [[Catherine (project moon)|]] with [[grey hair]], [[white skin]], and [[blank eyes]]. She wears a [[greyscale]] version of her outfit, with a [[white dress]] and [[black jacket]] with [[black gloves]].

title: nelly_(project_moon)
body:
[[Heathcliff (project moon)|]] and [[Catherine (project moon)|]]'s former caretaker and a character who appears in Canto VI of [[Limbus Company]]. She coincidentally bears a passing resemblance to [[Outis (project moon)|]] and is based on the character of the same name from "Wuthering Heights":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuthering_Heights.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]] and [[brown eyes]], and [[dark skin]]. While referred to as a butler in-game, she wears a [[frills|frilled]] [[maid]] uniform including the [[maid headdress|headdress]] and [[maid apron|apron]], along with a [[grey ascot]]. In combat, she uses [[cutlery]], especially [[knife|knives]], as [[throwing knife|thrown weapons]].

His birthday is March 6.

body:
The "Memory of [[Gensokyo]]".

Resident historian of the [[Touhou]] series and ninth (and current) incarnation of the "Child of Miare", possessing a photographic memory as well as the ability to recall memories from her previous incarnations ([[hieda no aichi|Aichi]], [[hieda no ani|Ani]], [[hieda no ami|Ami]], [[hieda no ayo|Ayo]], [[hieda no ago|Ago]], [[hieda no amu|Amu]], [[hieda no anana|Anana]] and [[hieda no aya|Aya]]). In-universe author of [i]Perfect Memento in Strict Sense[/i] and [i]Symposium of Post-Mysticism[/i], encyclical works on the various faces, places, and dates in Gensokyo. Also writes mystery fiction under the pen name [[Agatha Chris Q outfit (touhou)|Agatha Chris Q]]. Her original, "zeroth" incarnation was the author [[Hieda no Are]], writer of the Kojiki.

After it was revealed that all Children of Miare generally live for around 30 years in [i]Strange Creators of Outer World[/i], some fans began to count the days until Akyuu's 30th birthday, which would be, according to [i]Perfect Memento[/i], around August/September 2024 (earliest August 7, latest September 6). However, ZUN has confirmed that Akyuu wouldn't die, and that the other characters wouldn't grow old, as the series runs on 'Sazae-san time', a floating timeline (commonly called "Comic Book Time" in the west due to its heavy use in that media). This didn't stop fans from awaiting the day. Around August 7th, 2024, fans "across":[https://twitter.com/richard_effendi/status/1821886649661321351] the world began discussing the death of Hieda no Akyuu.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hieda no Akyuu":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hieda_no_Akyuu

title: winged_fusiliers
body:
[b]Winged Fusiliers[/b] is a Japanese fantasy comic made by the artist [[Asterisk Kome]].

It feature an alternate reality and history, where bird men and women exist and a major change in our history happened. [[World War I]] lasted longer than our own due to the creation of the Ironclads, giant armored and weaponized [[dirigible]]s, cementing the situation of the trench war even harder than before. 

The story separated into two main era between [[World War I]] and the Cold War.

title: iron_man_(2008)
body:
The first movie based on the [[Iron Man (series)|]] series. Released in 2008, and was the first film in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]].
The film stars [[Robert Downey Jr.]] as [[Tony Stark]] / [[Iron Man]] alongside Terrence Howard, Jeff Bridges, Gwyneth Paltrow, Leslie Bibb, and Shaun Toub. In the film, following his escape from captivity by a terrorist group, world-famous industrialist and master engineer Tony Stark builds a mechanized suit of armor and becomes the superhero Iron Man.

title: neofam
body:
A fictional combat [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

The [b]Neofam[/b] is an advanced (but cheaper and less powerful) red and white colored version of the [[Vifam]] combat [[Round Vernian]]. 

It's built with more sophisticated sensors so it is usually used for aggressive reconnaissance missions.

title: vifam_trainer
body:
A fictional generic training [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

It is an unarmed version of the [[Vifam]] [[Round Vernian]] painted in a yellow, white and red color scheme.

title: dillfam
body:
A fictional generic combat [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

The [b]Dillfam[/b] is the most basic [[soldier]] [[Round Vernian]] of the human colonial defense forces. It is painted in a [[military]] green and white color pattern.

As a ground-based manned battle robot it lacks [[thrusters]] and vernier rockets.

title: torunfam
body:
A fictional combat [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

The [b]Torunfam[/b] is a human [[military]] [[Round Vernian]] optimized for aerospace missions. It is painted in a light and dark blue color pattern.

title: vifam
body:
The titular fictional [[mecha]] from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]] anime series [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]]. 

The [b]Vifam[/b] is an advanced and powerful all-environment multi-role combat [[Round Vernian]]. It's painted in a dark blue, white and red color pattern.

In [[real life]] it was designed by legendary mecha artist [[Ookawara Kunio]] (famous for his work in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]).

h4.See also
* [[Vifam Trainer]]

title: astrogator_round_vernian
body:
[b]The Astrogator Round Vernian[/b], also known as [b]ARV[/b], is the Earthians' expedient name for the [[mecha]] that the [[kuktonian|Kuktonians]] used in [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]]. The [[Round Vernian]] is a type of Earthian's mecha in the show.

They were [[alien|extraterrestrials]] living in the Ypserlon solar system, and their three habitable planets, including their home planet Kukuto, were polluted by a nuclear war. For over 1000 years, they lived in space colonies built in the asteroid area. Earthians from Earth, 43 light-years away, did not consider them the natives of the solar system, but called them Astrogators.
The Kuktonians' official name for the ARVs was never revealed, but in the story, they called this type of weapon, [b]mobile weapons[/b] (機動兵器), or [b]mobile mecha[/b] (機動メカ).

h4.List of ARVs

title: x-men:_first_class
body: X-Men: First Class (stylized on-screen as X: First Class) is a 2011 superhero film based on the [[X-Men]] characters appearing in Marvel Comics. It is the fourth mainline installment in the [[X-Men film series]] and the fifth installment overall. It was directed by Matthew Vaughn and produced by Bryan Singer, and stars James McAvoy, [[Michael Fassbender]], Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, January Jones, Oliver Platt, and Kevin Bacon. At the time of its release, it was intended to be a franchise reboot and contradicted the events of previous films; however, the follow-up film [[X-Men: Days of Future Past]] (2014) retconned First Class into a prequel to [[X-Men (2000)]]. First Class is set primarily in 1962 during the Cuban Missile Crisis, and focuses on the relationship between [[Charles Xavier]] and Erik Lehnsherr / [[Magneto]], and the origin of their groups—the X-Men and the Brotherhood of Mutants, respectively, as they deal with the Hellfire Club led by Sebastian Shaw, a mutant supremacist bent on enacting nuclear war.

title: x-men_origins:_wolverine
body: X-Men Origins: Wolverine is a 2009 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics fictional character [[Wolverine (x-men)|]]. It is the fourth installment of the [[X-Men film series]], the first installment of the Wolverine trilogy within the series, and a spin-off/prequel to [[X-Men (2000)]] and [[X2 (2003)]].

title: x-men_(2000)
body:
X-Men is a 2000 American superhero film directed by Bryan Singer  based on the [[Marvel]] Comics superhero team of the same name. Featuring an ensemble cast consisting of [[Patrick Stewart]], [[Hugh Jackman]], [[Ian McKellen]], [[Halle Berry]], Famke Janssen, James Marsden, Bruce Davison, Rebecca Romijn-Stamos, Ray Park, and Anna Paquin, the film depicts a world where an unknown proportion of people are mutants, possessing superhuman powers that make them distrusted by normal humans. It focuses on mutants Wolverine and Rogue as they are brought into a conflict between two groups with radically different approaches to bringing about the acceptance of mutant-kind: Charles Xavier's [[X-Men]], and the Brotherhood of Mutants, led by [[Magneto]].
Its success led to a [[X-men film series|series of films]].

title: jezail
body:
The Jezail is an [[afghanistan|Afghan]] [[matchlock]] or [[flintlock]] [[musket]] fired from a forked rest.

Jezails usually have what seem to be unusually long barrels and of a higher caliber than other frontier guns - as a result of their purely military use. The added length also made reloading easier from horseback, as the butt stock would rest upon the ground while the muzzle would be at eye level.  It has been speculated that the highly curved stock was tucked under the arm and cradled tightly against the body, as opposed to being held to the shoulder like a standard musket or rifle. 

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Rifle]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Jezail":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jezail

title: naganami_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
She visually deviates from the standard uniform by wearing a grey [[blazer]] over the uniform which now has a sheer black underskirt. Her pantyhose has also been reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style. This style would become the standard winter Kai-Ni-Yuugumo-class uniform. She also trades her yellow hair tie, which bound her hair in an updo, for a long [[white hairband]] (the most obvious change if not depicted in uniform) and letting her [[hair down]] in the process.

She later gets a summer uniform similar to [[yuugumo (kancolle)|Yuugumo]]'s upon the latter's own second remodel, consisting of a violet [[vest]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt, black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned thighhighs.

Her pantyhose has also been reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style.

She later gets the standard Yuugumo-class summer uniform, consisting of a violet [[vest]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt (complete with the green gradient), black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned thighhighs.

title: yamakaze_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[yamakaze (kancolle)|Yamakaze]] received her Kai Ni on September 28, 2021.

Upon receiving kai ni, her detached sleeves switches to [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] with [[wrist cuffs]], a [[double-breasted]] design, a [[green neckerchief]], [[twin_braids|a pair of long braids]], and the class-standard [[hair flaps]] which are not noticeable at first glance since her hair is already somewhat messy in her base form.

A difference exists in her alternate anti-submarine version: she has [[depth charge|depth charges]] on her left/portside rig, but she loses the 25 mm AA guns on her [[wristband]] present on her base kai ni.

title: shoukaku_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
For [[Shoukaku (Kancolle)|her second remodels]], Shoukaku has two forms that she can remodel between: standard CV Kai Ni at level 80, which can field the second highest number of planes with a balanced arrangement, and an armored carrier Form Kai Ni-A at level 88, which gives her better armor, the strongest potential firepower of all carriers and the ability to launch planes at moderate damage for the price of a lower plane count and higher maintenance costs. 

These remodels are noted to be hypothetical since she was sunk in the Battle of the Philippine Sea (June 19, 1944) before she could receive upgrades, including catapults that were part of the class' original design (reflected in her requiring a prototype catapult item for the first remodel)

In both forms, she wears an improved version of her base outfit and [[rigging]], with a different boot design (simple [[thighhighs]] with improved [[rudder footwear]]) as well as red [[tasuki]]. She is given a full-size yumi instead of the shorter [[bow (weapon)|]] she previously used. 

For Kai Ni, she has a wooden [[flight deck]] and an uniformly [[red hairband]]. For Kai Ni - A, her flight deck is painted black and gains a tan [[hairband]] with a white stripe. Armor plating has been attached to her thighhighs. Across both forms, her aircraft catapult is prominently seen on the portside, while the fire control directors on her waist mounts are replaced with 12.7 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #2132398: Base
* !post #2132394: Kai ni-A

h4. See also

* [[Zuikaku Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]

title: zuikaku_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
For her kai ni forms, [[zuikaku_(kancolle)|Zuikaku]]'s is basically a hypothetical remodel where she survived the Battle of Leyte Gulf (October 25, 1944) and received aircraft catapults as originally designed. An alternate second remodel depicts her in a hypothetical armored carrier form a la [[taihou_(kancolle)|Taihou]].

She has the same set up as [[Shoukaku Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Shoukaku's]]. The only real difference is that Kai Ni keeps her color scheme and camouflage from Kai form (a camouflage [[kimono]] and [[brown skirt|brown]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[hakama skirt]]) and Kai Ni A restores her original [[white kimono]] and [[red skirt]]. She also has a different stat spread than Shoukaku, favoring AA and Evasion to her Firepower. She also remodels at different levels: Kai Ni at Level 77 and Kai Ni - A at Level 90.

The main visual differences between Zuikaku K2 and non-remodeled Zuikaku are following: 2 tasukis instead of 1, [[black thighhighs]], and improved [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[flight deck]] also gains an [[aircraft catapult]] on the portside. For Kai Ni A, her flight deck is colored black.

Zuikaku K2 has had 2 seasonal [[official alternate costume|alternate outfits]]: a Christmas outfit (post #3340291) that regularly appears in-game during the month of December, and a [[long hair]] outfit (post #3022277 and post #3022286) for the Leyte Gulf-themed events that took place in 2018.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2164179: Base
* !post #2164192: Armored carrier

h4. See also

* [[Shoukaku Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]

title: hyuuga_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
In her kai ni form, [i]Hyuuga[/i] discards the heavy [[rigging]] of her base/kai forms and opts for a simpler style: two 410 mm triple mounts to her left and her [[flight deck]] and [[quiver]] on her right. Her clothing choice ([[white kimono]], [[black skirt|black]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black socks|black kneehighs]], white [[hachimaki]]) are now easily visible. However, one noticeable difference from these plans is the presence of helicopter landing markings on her flight deck, which is reflective of her [[JS Hyuuga|JMSDF DDH namesake]].

[[Hyuuga (kancolle)|]] is most notable for being an "Aviation Battleship" after problems with her fifth turret (which detonated during gunnery practice), and the sinking of most major fleet carriers made the IJN desperate for more carrier capacity. Historically, this never panned out well, as the IJN was out of pilots and planes to launch by the time Hyuuga and Ise were ready. Her Kai Ni partially reflects a "2/3 conversion" plan that would have retained only the two forward main gun mounts and convert the rest into a carrier. This was historically ruled out as well, since the capacity would be too big for the launching facility (2 catapults) to keep up, causing delays when launching attack squadrons.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3458629

h4. See also

* [[Ise Kai Ni (kancolle)|]]

title: tuscaloosa_kai_(kancolle)
body:
[[Tuscaloosa (Kancolle)|]]'s kai form portrays her in her wartime guise, with her [[rigging]] painted in Measure 12 two-tone navy blue and haze grey and the presence of a [[radar]] on her left rig. Besides those, her [[white dress]] has a darker tone reflective of her wartime paint scheme.

h4. Appearance

title: satsuki_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
For her second remodel/kai ni, [[Satsuki (Kancolle)|]] is given a new uniform similar to Mutsuki's and Kisaragi's own second remodels, but following the design principles of [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]]'s class uniform. 

She wears a dark [[blue jacket]] over her original white [[serafuku]]. Her skirt is replaced by [[culottes]], which however look exactly like a [[miniskirt]], so she still gets often depicted wearing a regular skirt.

She has a [[yellow neckerchief]] and her [[crescent pin]] has moved to her collar. An orange [[scarf]] is tied to her right arm and she has a [[brown belt]] around her waist, carrying three spare torpedoes and a 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]], which she holds with her left arm. She also sports a Type 13 [[radar]] antenna held by two [[thigh strap]]s on her left leg. The AA guns (as well as her AA-spec stat upgrades) reflect how she was historically rearmed as an anti-air destroyer late in the war.

h4. Appearance

title: fumizuki_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
For her second remodel/kai ni, [[Fumizuki (Kancolle)|]] wears a modified version of the [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]]-designed [i]Mutsuki[/i]-class uniform similar to [[Satsuki Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Satsuki's]]. She wears a dark [[blue jacket]] over a [[white shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]] and a [[yellow neckerchief]] with a [[crescent pin]]. She retains her [[black skirt]] and black kneehighs.

Her [[rigging]] has her wield a 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type B/C (which she never had in real life), two 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s strapped on her sides to a [[brown belt]], and a Type 13 [[radar]] antenna held by [[thigh strap]]s on her left leg.

title: abukuma_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
In her kai ni form, [[Abukuma (Kancolle)|]] wears an almost entirely new uniform. The [[serafuku]] now consists of a short-sleeved [[black jacket]] over a beige top, a [[grey sailor collar]] and [[grey_skirt|grey pleated skirt]] with [[bike shorts]] [[shorts_under_skirt|underneath]]. She also now wears a [[red_ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[black_gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], while retaining her boots.

As for her [[rigging]], she now carries two 12.7 cm twin guns Type 89 as [[handgun]]s. 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] are attached to her boots and now includes a shield-like platform with anti-air guns and [[radar]]. Gameplay wise, she becomes the first Light Cruiser who can carry a midget submarine and a transport ship, and thus ends up being an easy target for players circumventing ship type restrictions in events. As the remodel is hypothetical, she needs a high level and a blueprint to remodel to this point.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2071209

* [b]Abukuma[/b]

title: south_dakota_kai_(kancolle)
body:
In her first remodel/kai, [[South Dakota (Kancolle)|]] switches to a [[black jacket]] referring to her historical counterpart adopting "Measure 21":[https://www.shipcamouflage.com/measure_21.htm] camouflage for majority of her career. 

The previously mentioned remodel includes upgrades to her main battery of 406 mm/16-inch Mk6 triple guns. The seemingly disproportionately large size of her weaponry compared to her body reflects the somewhat flawed characteristics of the historical fast battleships: Trying to fit 16-inch guns and corresponding armor but staying within the parameters set by the Washington Naval Treaty, resulting in cramped ships. (Although another reason for her short stature may be because "the youngest American serviceman of World War II":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Graham] actually served aboard her in Guadalcanal.)

h4. Appearance

* !post #3994403

title: kayoko_(fukuro_daizi)

title: gambier_bay_mk_ii_(kancolle)
body:
In her Mk.II form, the most obvious change to [[Gambier Bay (Kancolle)|]] is that her [[blue jacket]] is now [[open jacket|open]], while she wears a second inner layer [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with a gray [[corset]] with life rafts strapped. She changes from white shorts to a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]] with a [[black belt]] and [[side slit]] with her real-life hull number. Her [[white thighhighs]] gain wings of FM-2 Wildcats strapped to them.

Her needing a prototype [[aircraft catapult]] for remodel is somewhat arbitrary on the developers' part since she was fitted with a catapult from the start. Her catapult is seen as a black line running on the side of her bow hull number on her [[flight deck]] [[rigging]].

title: kisaragi_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
For the 2nd anniversary of [i]Kantai Collection[/i] (April 2015), [[Kisaragi (Kancolle)|she]], along with [[Mutsuki (Kancolle)|]], gained a second remodel/kai ni.

They now feature a dark [[blue jacket]] with their names (+ Kai Ni) on the sleeves and a [[crescent pin]] on both the jacket (both at the same place) and the [[serafuku]], now with a [[red scarf]]. On their [[rigging]] is a flower, like Uzuki and Yayoi, bridging the later design with the earlier one. They also come with a 12.7cm [[anti-aircraft gun|twin DP gun mount]] along with their standard 12cm single gun. This remodel is noted to be completely fictional, however, Kisaragi being the second major warship sunk in the war (and the first amongst those represented in the game to date, lost in the battle of Wake Island, December 1941). Kisaragi herself has the crescent pin on the lower left side of her serafuku. Her flower seems to be a purple Stock.

body:
[[Noshiro (kancolle)|]] was the first of the [i]Agano[/i]-class to be given a second remodel on February 6, 2021. In this form, she switches to a new [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], a [[black dress]] shirt worn under a long-sleeved sailor shirt with a [[black sailor collar]], and a black stylized [[necktie]]. She now also wears a pair of [[black thighhighs]] held by [[garter straps]]. She now goes gloveless as well.

title: haguro_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Haguro (Kancolle)|]]'s kai ni form, released on 23/05/2014, gives her a new modified uniform shared with her fellow sister ships' second remodel. She uses the vanilla [[rigging]] of the class (five twin 203 mm twin mounts with handles plus four 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]]), and wears the vanilla version of the class' purple [[military uniform]], [[white pantyhose]], [[white gloves]], and black [[pencil skirt]]; with the only difference being her original [[hair ornament]] (representing her real-life mainmast and crane) being retained in this form.

Gameplay-wise, she receives a significant stat boost, mainly her torpedo stat (as she was historically responsible for sinking [[De Ruyter (Kancolle)|]] with a single torpedo in the battle of the Java Sea) and evasion stat (as she had outlasted most other IJN heavy cruisers when she herself was sunk in May 1945).

h4. Appearance

* !post #1921382

title: honolulu_kai_(kancolle)
body:
[[Honolulu (Kancolle)|]]'s Kai (first remodel) form, the most readily noticeable distinguishing feature between this and her base from is presence of vertical [[American Flag Print|red-white-blue stripe pattern]] that is adorned with the real-life eight battle stars (as improvised [[double-breasted]] buttons) that the base Honolulu lacks.

As for her rigging, she gains a camouflage pattern (more specifically, Measure 32 Design 2c) that she "historically wore in 1944":[https://www.navsource.org/archives/04/048/0404808.jpg]. In addition, she discards the spray shields of her 12.7 cm single pedestal mounts present in her base form.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4558576

title: ise_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
Upon her second remodel, released 2018/06/13, [[Ise (kancolle)|]]'s outfit and [[rigging]] change to a form best befitting of her historical fame as a BB-CV hybrid while introducing a new form to audiences. While Ise's kai form reflects her real-life conversion to a hybrid battleship carrier, her Kai Ni reflects stillborn plans that would have seen her drastically converted to a true BB-CV hybrid.

Her rigging changes to two 410 mm triple mounts to her right and a full [[flight deck]] plus [[quiver]] to her left, discarding the heavy rig layout of her base/kai forms. This exposes her [[white kimono]] top and [[black skirt|black]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[hakama short skirt]] while she now gains a long [[white hairband|white]] [[hachimaki]] and retains her [[black socks|black kneehighs]] and [[rudder footwear]].

A 2/3 conversion was put forward during design plans in light of [[Hyuuga (kancolle)|]]'s turret explosion prior to Midway, where the #1 and #2 turret were to be retained and convert the rest into a carrier. This was historically ruled out since the capacity would be too big for the launching facility (2 catapults) to keep up, causing delays when launching attack squadrons. Ultimately, a cheaper 1/3 conversion took place after Midway. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #3158323

h4. See also

* [[Hyuuga Kai Ni (kancolle)|]]

title: umikaze_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Umikaze (Kancolle)|]] obtained her second remodel on the June 25th 2019 update. 

Her outfit is essentially a blue version of [[Kawakaze Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kawakaze]]'s own kai ni outfit while she keeps the single [[thigh strap]], now on the right. Her hair and eyes don't change colors and her [[hair flaps]] are small, short yet conspicuous, standing erect and out of the way of her hair feathering. In addition, she also has a [[bandaged arm|bandaged right arm]].

As for her [[rigging]], she gains a 12.7 cm single mount Type A as a [[handgun]] to her left while she gains a third 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] in a new side rig to her left. The thigh-mounted torpedo tubes are moved from her left leg to her right.

title: kawakaze_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
Upon kai ni/second remodel, [[kawakaze (kancolle)|Kawakaze]] wears a more ornate version of her original uniform with red trimming, analogous to the typical [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class Kai Ni uniform. Added to this is a tattered [[black_scarf|black]] and [[white scarf]] a la Yuudachi. She gains [[hair flaps]], [[gradient_hair|a gradient to her hair]] (it now fades to blue), [[twin braids]] in place of her twintails and [[yellow_eyes|her eyes changes color to golden yellow]].

Her [[rigging]] is also updated, where her 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her right/starboard rig is replaced with a second 12.7 cm twin gun mount type C augmenting her existing [[handgun]] mount, while she gains reload torpedoes on [[thigh strap|thigh straps]]. She also carries three [[depth charge|depth charges]] on her chest belt.

title: akigumo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Akigumo (Kancolle)|]]'s kai ni on October 16, 2020 combines the standard winter Yuugumo-class Kai Ni uniform -- a mostly grey [[blazer]] over the standard Yuugumo-class uniform, an additional sheer black underskirt, and [[grey thighhighs|grey]] [[over-kneehighs]] -- with several [i]Kagerou[/i] elements, most notably a grey-colored [[pleated skirt]] dress as opposed to the purple ones seen on the [i]Yuugumos[/i]. This is a reference to the long-standing confusion over which class Akigumo really belonged (as she shared the Yuugumo-class nomenclature with Kagerou-class hull design.)

A [[drawing tablet]], a [[stylus]], and a single left black partially fingerless drawer's glove are also included in her gear. Her hair now [[gradient hair|gradiates]] to [[blonde hair|blonde]] as well near the end, something not seen in [[Akigumo (Kancolle)|her base form]]. This hybridized remodel, however, gives rise to an introductory line in which she distances herself from either class, probably as a reference to the supposed nameship status described in documents declassified in 1994 (where she is listed as "Kagerou-class - Akigumo".)

h4. Appearance

They now feature a dark [[blue jacket]] with their names (+ Kai Ni) on the sleeves and a [[crescent pin]] on both the jacket (both at the same place) and the [[green_serafuku|serafuku]], now with a [[red scarf]]. On their [[rigging]] is a flower, like Uzuki and Yayoi, bridging the later design with the earlier one. They also come with a 12.7cm [[anti-aircraft gun|twin gun mount]] along with their standard 12cm single gun. This remodel is noted to be completely fictional, however, Mutsuki having been sunk relatively early in the war (during the Guadalcanal Campaign). Mutsuki herself has the crescent pin on her serafuku scarf. Her flower is a camellia, flower of her namesake month (January).

title: tenryuu_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
Upon reaching Kai Ni, [[Tenryuu_(kancolle)|]]'s hair becomes slightly longer and she wears a [[fur-trimmed_jacket|fur-trimmed]], [[black_jacket|black jacket]] [[off shoulder]], revealing a [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]], [[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white_shirt|white shirt]] underneath it, tucked in a [[black_skirt|black]], [[pleated_skirt|pleated]], [[high-waist_skirt|high-waist skirt]]. 

Alongside her [[sword]], her [[rigging]] now shows multiple late model 12.7cm Twin High-angle Guns.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3187762

title: oboro_kai_(kancolle)
body:
From Christmas 2015, [[Oboro (Kancolle)|]] is drawn taller (if not older) than her unremodeled self and she wears [[knee pads]] and [[elbow pads]]. Her hair is swept backwards and she features three [[ahoge]] radiating from the same spot.

For her [[rigging]], she replaces her original 12.7 cm twin mount Type B with a 10 cm twin mount with a crescent moon sticker on the back. It also shows her having a [[medium breasts|decently sized chest]] for a destroyer but a bit smaller than her sister Ushio. As for the moon, her namesake is strongly identified with the moon, and she is associated with [[Akizuki (kancolle)|]] (Autumn Moon), as Akizuki's very first mission was escorting [[zuikaku (kancolle)|]] with Oboro.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2204051

title: saegusa_(gundam)
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985. Also appears in the sequel TV series [[Gundam ZZ]] (1986).

[b]Saegusa[/b] is a [[serious]] [[brown hair]]ed man with thick eyebrows who is a member of the [[AEUG]] [[Argama]]'s bridge crew. [spoilers]He is seriously injured by [[Yazan Gable]] piloting a cargo [[mecha]] at the begining of ZZ but recuperates from his wounds and appears in the final episode of the series to bid farewell to [[Judau Ashta]].[/spoilers]

title: list_of_eiyuu_densetsu_characters
body:
A list of tagged characters from the [[Eiyuu Densetsu]] series. 

[tn]WIP - the [[Sen no Kiseki (series)]] sections are very bloated and needlessly redundant. there are multiple ways this could be fixed but at the very least I don't think Sen I-IV each need their own section where they repeat the main cast (Class 7/New Class 7) multiple times. [[Hajimari no Kiseki]] exclusive characters need to be listed. [[Zero no Kiseki|Zero]] and [[Ao no Kiseki|Ao]] could probably be put into one section and I believe there are a handful of missing characters there as well. I plan to do all this sometime but I'm making this a public note in case any other Kiseki fan wants to take the initiative. Thank you.[/tn]

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Gagharv trilogy":#dtext-gagharv
** 1.1. "Shiroki Majo":#dtext-shiroki
** 1.2. "Akai Shizuku":#dtext-akai
** 1.3. "Umi no Oriuta":#dtext-umi
* 2. "Sora no Kiseki trilogy":#dtext-sora
* 3. "Crossbell duology":#dtext-crossbell
** 3.1. "Zero no Kiseki":#dtext-zero
** 3.2. "Ao no Kiseki":#dtext-ao
* 4. "Sen no Kiseki series":#dtext-sen
** 4.1. "Sen no Kiseki I":#dtext-sen

** 4.3. "Sen no Kiseki III":#dtext-sen3

[/expand]

title: purgatory_(quackity_smp)
body:
Major plot event in [[Quackity SMP]] where the residents of Quesadilla Island were taken to Egg Island (AKA "Purgatory"), divided into teams, and then made to compete for survival. It had a second iteration as well, where new guest players were included.

h5. Purgatory teams
* [[Team Bolas (quackity smp)|]]
* Team Soulfire: [[Tubbo]], [[Pactw]], [[BadBoyHalo]], Aypierre, [[TinaKitten]], [[Nihachu]], Arin, [[ElMariana]], Lenay, MissaSinfonia, [[RiversGG]], Polispol
* [[Team Green Ninjas (quackity smp)|]]

h4. External links
* "QSMP Wiki: Purgatory Event":https://qsmp.fandom.com/wiki/Purgatory_Event

title: team_green_ninjas_(quackity_smp)
body:
A team in [[Quackity SMP]]'s first [[Purgatory (quackity smp)|]] event. It consisted of [[Etoiles (youtuber)|]], [[FitMC]], [[ElQuackity]], [[Roier (youtuber)|]], [[Ironmouse]], [[oiBagi]], ForeverPlayer, [[AgenteMaxo]], Kameto, and Antoine Daniel.

Green Ninjas would be dissolved in week 2, with Bagi, ElQuackity, Fit, Forever and Kameto being sent to Soulfire, and Antoine, Etoiles, Ironmouse, Maxo and Roier being sent to [[team bolas (quackity smp)|Bolas]].

This tag should only be used if multiple team members are present (ideally most of them) or the team is directly referenced in the post.

h4. External links
* "QSMP Wiki: Team Green Ninjas":https://qsmp.fandom.com/wiki/Team_Green_Ninjas

title: team_bolas_(quackity_smp)
body:
A team in [[Quackity SMP]]'s first [[Purgatory (quackity smp)|]] event. It consists of [[Ph1LzA]], [[Foolish Gamers]], [[Slimecicle]], [[Cellbit]], [[Jaiden Animations]], [[Baghera Jones]], and [[Carre]].

After [[Team Green Ninjas (quackity smp)|]] disbanded, Antoine Daniel, [[Etoiles (youtuber)|]], [[Ironmouse]], [[AgenteMaxo|Maxo]] and [[Roier (youtuber)|]] were assigned to Bolas.

This tag should only be used if multiple team members are present (ideally most of them) or the team is directly referenced in the post.

h4. External links
* "QSMP Wiki: Team Bolas":https://qsmp.fandom.com/wiki/Team_Bolas

h4. External links
* "QSMP Wiki: Pepito":https://qsmp.fandom.com/wiki/Pepito

title: trump_(quackity_smp)
body:
[[Quackity SMP]] non-player character, the adopted son of [[AgenteMaxo]] and DanTDM. Wears a [[propeller hat]]. Sometimes called "Trumpet" by fans, and referred to by the official merch shop as "Frump".

One of the first eggs to die, having a very short lifespan due to no one on the island completing the egg tasks - considered to be the greatest failure of the server's members as someone could have saved him, but no one did.

h4. External links
* "QSMP Wiki: Trump":https://qsmp.fandom.com/wiki/Trump

title: elquackity
body:
A [[Quackity SMP]] character, the evil twin brother of [[Quackity]]. Out-of-universe, he also represents Quackity's Spanish-language streams, as ElQuackity is the name of his Spanish-language channel.

h4. Appearance
ElQuackity appears identical to Quackity aside from his outfit, which typically features the Mexican flag somewhere.

title: image_macro_(meme)
body:
An image with a caption added, generally for humorous effect. These tend to feature [[Impact (font)]] more often than not.

Does not apply to [[subtitled]] [[anime screenshot|screenshots]].

It can be fully opening from [[bare shoulders|shoulders]] to [[legs]], or at least opening at the [[upper body]] from [[armpits]], [[sideboob]] to waist, [[bare hips|hip]].

title: gunbai
body:
Specific type of Japanese fan used by military officers to communicate with their troops. Generally made of solid wood, metal, or wood with metal framework. Also used by scoring referees in [[sumo]] wrestling matches.

The weapon of choice of [[Uchiha Madara]], whose large gunbai resembles a guitar.

h4. See also

title: cassetti_(project_moon)
body:
Cassetti is a chapter antagonist in [[Limbus Company]], specifically appearing in Intervallo IV.2: Murder on the WARP Express.

He is a sixth-generation Bloodfiend who takes over the WARP train to use its passengers as bloodbags to do his bidding and to sustain him on their blood, and believes himself to be a prince due to his high ranking in the lineage.

He is named after the "the true name of the victim from Murder on the Orient Express":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder_on_the_Orient_Express, following the theme of the two Intervallo IVs being inspired by Agatha Christie's works.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a [[stitched face|stitched-on]] [[masquerade mask]] made of human skin, with his eyes not being visible behind it. He wears a [[red scarf]] and [[black suit|black]] [[suit jacket]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] and [[ascot]]. For his bottoms, he has [[dress pants]] fastened by a [[black belt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[dress shoes]]. On his wrist is a [[silver bracelet]], and a [[ring]] on each finger of his hand. He is seen in his sprite to be [[holding cane|holding a cane]].

[spoilers]He is killed by [[Don Quixote (project moon)|]] after she loses control once Rocinante (her shoes) fall off during a confrontation, revealing herself to be a second-generation one and higher on the hierarchy before obliterating him completely.[/spoilers]

title: piss_tea_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated a scene from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] part 5 [[Vento Aureo]].

The scene involves a [[tea party]] hosted by the Passione members to welcome [[Giorno Giovanna]]. After a brief conversation, [[Leone Abbacchio]] who is despising Giorno's idealism at that time, secretly [[peeing]] inside a [[teapot]] under the table and hands it over to Giorno to "prove [his] trustworthiness". Giorno then dramatically [[drinking pee|drank the whole cup of "tea" without hesitation]], much to Abbacchio's shock. [spoiler]In reality, Giorno uses the power of [[Gold Experience]] to turn one of his tooth into a jellyfish to absorb the "tea" without actually tasting it.[/spoiler]

This particular scene later spawned the slang "Aba-[[tea]]" (アバ茶 [i]"aba-cha"[/i]), which later became a byword for [[drinking pee|pee drinking]]/serving fetish.

title: off-shoulder_sweater
body:
A specific type of shoulder-less [[sweater]] which is [i]naturally designed[/i] with a low and wide-cut neckline which ensures that the garment sits just below the shoulders, leaving them and the wearer's upper chest area [[bare shoulders|bare]]. Often features a thicker, sometimes mantle-like hem along the top.

Off-shoulder sweaters are meant to emphasize and accentuate the wearer's shoulders, [[collarbone]], and neck (or [[nape]]), with the sleeves of an off-shoulder sweater sitting on the upper arms instead of on top of the shoulders.

Frequently appears as a distinct variant of [[ribbed sweater]].

h4.Correct examples
* !post #4351959: [[Belfast (Azur Lane)|Belfast]] ([[belfast_(shopping_with_the_head_maid)_(azur_lane)|Shopping with the Head Maid]])
* !post #7623532: [[Yor Briar]] (most depictions of her casual red sweater attire)
* !post #2687701: [[Sagisawa Fumika|Fumika]]
* !post #7960291
* !post #5010219
* !post #7748666: An off-shoulder sweater with exposed [[bra strap]]s

h4.Incorrect examples
This tag is [b]not[/b] meant as a "catch-all" tag for any sweaters that simply exposes the bare shoulders; the following sweater styles are not off-shoulder sweaters:
* !post #7968227: An open/partially opened sweater worn hanging off the arms
* !post #1553067: A normal or moderately wide-necked sweater simply being worn [[off shoulder]]
* !post #7812490: [[Shoulder cutout]]
* !post #5100249: [[Sleeveless sweater]]
* !post #6811541: A [[sleeveless sweater]] worn with [[detached sleeves]]/[[elbow gloves]]
* !post #5562588: [[Single-shoulder sweater]]

h6.Mutually exclusive tags
* [[Single-shoulder sweater]].

h4. See also

* [[Aran sweater]]

title: dog_(elden_ring)_(meme)
body:
An inside joke for [[Elden Ring]] players to refer to any wild animal in the game as a "[[dog]]". Especially [[turtle]]s, due to being nearly immobile and thus likely to stay near any [[message (fromsoftware)|messages]] left near them.

The criteria for what can and what cannot be considered a "dog" are somewhat vague. Usually it is restricted to mundane, non-hostile quadrupeds, but some players include [[dragon]]s.

title: kick-ass
body: Kick-Ass (also known as [[Hit-Girl]] & Kick-Ass, or simply Hit-Girl) is a media franchise based on the adventures of superheroes of the same name, created by Mark Millar and John Romita Jr. Set in the Millarworld, it began in 2008 with Marvel's Kick-Ass – The [[Dave Lizewski]] Years, followed by the anthology Millarworld Annual from 2016 to 2017, two stand-alone sequel series, Kick-Ass – The New Girl and Hit-Girl, from 2018 to 2020, and two crossover series, Kick-Ass vs. Hit-Girl and Big Game, in 2020 and 2023. In the series, Hit-Girl is a young vigilante (later a Kingsman agent) going around the world stopping crime in violent ways, while Kick-Ass has had three people take the mantle, a hero (Dave Lizewski), a sidekick (Paul McQue), and a villain (Patience Lee).

title: dodge_(company)
body:
An American [[car]] company, particularly known for their history of producing [[muscle car]]s. A subsidiary brand of [[Chrysler]], Dodge is one of the many brands of the Stellantis Group. 

The [[RAM (brand)|]] line of [[pickup truck]]s were formerly part of the Dodge lineup before being spun off into a separate dedicated brand for work vehicles.

Dodge previously had a robust presence in motorsports, fielding cars in [[NASCAR]] and entering the Viper in the [[circuit de la sarthe|24 Hours of Le Mans]], but they've since scaled back their efforts to solely focus on drag racing in the [[National Hot Rod Association]].

title: metal_gear_solid
body:
[b]Metal Gear Solid[/b] (メタルギアソリッド, Metaru Gia Soriddo?, commonly abbreviated as [b]MGS[/b]) also known as [b]Metal Gear Solid: Tactical Espionage Action[/b] is a stealth action [[video game]] directed by [[Kojima Hideo]]. The game was developed by Konami Computer Entertainment Japan and first published by [[Konami]] in 1998 for the [[PlayStation 1]] video game console. 

It is the sequel to Kojima's early MSX2 computer games [[Metal Gear (series)|]] and Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake. The game featured cinematic cutscenes rendered using the in-game engine and graphics, as well as voice acting in numerous codec sequences.

Metal Gear Solid follows [[Solid Snake]], a soldier who infiltrates a nuclear weapons facility to neutralize the terrorist threat from FOXHOUND, a renegade special forces unit. Snake must liberate two hostages, the head of DARPA and the president of a major arms manufacturer, confront the terrorists, and stop them from launching a nuclear strike [spoilers]using an advanced combat [[mecha]] known as [[Metal Gear REX]][/spoilers].

Metal Gear Solid was very well received by critics and sold many units. It is recognized by many experts as one of the best and most important video games of all time, and heralded as the game which made the stealth genre popular. 

The commercial success of the title prompted the release of an expanded version for the PlayStation and PC, titled [i]Metal Gear Solid: Integral[/i]; and a remake with enhanced graphics, [i]Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes[/i] was later released for the [[Nintendo]] [[GameCube]]. The game has also spawned numerous sequels, prequels and spin-offs, including several games, a radio drama, comics, and novels.

A direct sequel called [[metal gear solid 2: sons of liberty|Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty]] was released in 2001.

h4. See also

* [[Mei Ling]]

title: dashboard
body:
A control panel set within the central console of a [[car]] or similar [[motor vehicle]].

Located directly ahead of the [[driving|driver]], it displays instrumentation and controls for the vehicle's operation. A dashboard houses the [[steering wheel]], fuel indicator, [[speedometer]] and other features.

For the aircraft counterpart, see [[cockpit]].

h4. See also

* [[car interior]]
* [[rear-view mirror]]
* [[side-view mirror]]
* [[windshield]]
* [[vehicle interior]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dashboard":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dashboard

title: side-view_mirror
body:
A [[mirror]] on the side of a [[motor vehicle]] for seeing behind and to the sides of the vehicle, outside the [[driving|driver]]'s peripheral vision (in the "blind spot").

h4. See also

* [[car interior]]
* [[headlight]]
* [[rear-view mirror]]
* [[vehicle interior]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Side-view mirror":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Side-view_mirror

title: rear-view_mirror
body:
A [[mirror]] in a [[car]] or other [[motor vehicle]], designed to allow the [[driving|driver]] to see rearward through the vehicle's rear window.

h4. See also

* [[car interior]]
* [[dashboard]]
* [[side-view mirror]]
* [[vehicle interior]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Rear-view mirror":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rear-view_mirror

title: windshield
body:
The front window of a [[motor vehicle]], such as an [[aircraft]], [[car]], [[bus]], [[motorcycle]], [[truck]], [[train]], [[boat]] or [[streetcar]].

It provides visibility while protecting the occupants. Windshields are generally made of laminated safety glass, polycarbonate or other impact resistant plastics.

h4. See also

* [[car interior]]
* [[dashboard]]
* [[rear-view mirror]]
* [[side-view mirror]]
* [[wipers]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Windshield":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windshield

title: table_knife
body:
A [[knife]] with a single cutting edge, and a blunt end. Table [[knife|knives]] are typically of moderate sharpness only, designed to cut prepared and cooked [[food]].

h4. See also

* [[butter knife]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Table knife":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Table_knife

title: sansevieria_(plant)
body:
A historically recognized genus of [[flower|flowering]] [[plant]]s, native to Africa and southern Asia. Being a common house plant, it is well known as the [b]snake plant[/b].

The plant is recognizable for having straight, stiff and pointed [[leaf|foliage]] like the [[aloe (plant)|]], while some species has yellow trim on the leaves' edges. The flower takes shape of multiple spider lily-like blooms on a single stalk.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sansevieria":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sansevieria

title: aloe_(plant)
body:
A genus of flowering succulent [[plant]]s. They are characterized by having a rosette of large, thick, pointy, and fleshy leaves - sometimes having pricks on them.

The most known species is [i]Aloe vera[/i], which its gel is commonly used for pharmaceutical purpose and being a common house plant.

h4. See also

* [[cactus]]
* [[sansevieria (plant)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Aloe":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aloe

title: breadbug
body:
An enemy appearing in the [[Pikmin (series)|Pikmin series]]. A small, bipedal creature with beige legs and face, as well as a brown body which notably looks similar to a loaf of [[bread]], hence its name.

It doesn't attack the player or and if their Pikmin, and instead try to drag treasures and the corpses of fallen creatures to its nest. It can only be damaged by an direct Pikmin throw or by bringing something it is holding to the ship, causing it to get dragged along and toppled over.

It also has a boss variant known as the [[Giant Breadbug]].

h4. External links

* "Pikmin Wiki: Breadbug":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Breadbug]

title: plasm_wraith
body:
Final boss of [[Pikmin 3]]. A giant, vaguely humanoid creature made of golden plasma, notably having a [[hole in head|hole on its face]]. Attacks by using its "arms" as spikes or by turning into puddles of plasma that are also elemental hazards. 

It takes [[Olimar]] captive and is very protective of him for unknown reasons. When [[alph (pikmin)|Alph]], [[brittany (pikmin)|Brittany]], and [[charlie (pikmin)|Charlie]] try to rescue him, it chases them through the Formidable Oak and fights them explicitly to keep him.

h4. External links

* "Pikmin Wiki: Plasm Wraith":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Plasm_Wraith]

title: onion_(pikmin)
body:
A type of [[aircraft]] throughout the [[Pikmin (series)|]] series that serves as transportation, housing, and reproduction for the [[pikmin (creature)|Pikmin]].

While the appearance of the onions has some minor variation between games, it keeps the general look of an onion bulb of at least one color, typically of the Pikmin type associated with it. It also has a [[white flower]] that acts as its propeller, and three thin yellow legs that are used by the Pikmin for entering or exiting the onion.

h4. External links

* "Pikmin Wiki: Onion":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Onion]

title: ice_pikmin
body:
A variety of [[Pikmin (creature)|]] that first appears in [[Pikmin 4]]. Their bodies are light blue in color, resembling ice and they occasionally have a [[yellow flower]] on their head. 

As they are made of ice, they are immune to it and can freeze enemies. However, they have much lower attack power compared to other Pikmin types.

h4. External links

* "Pikmin Wiki: Ice Pikmin":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Ice_Pikmin]

title: ayase_koyuki
body:
A character from [[Kokuhaku Jikkou Iinkai]]. In the Love Series, he is the love rival to [[Setoguchi Yuu]] and [[Enomoto Koutarou]], and the initial love interest of [[Setoguchi Hina]].

Ayase has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[light blue hair]]. He used to wear [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[glasses]], as well as having [[androgynous]] appearance.

h4. External links

* "Confession Executive Committee Wiki: Koyuki Ayase":https://lovecommittee.fandom.com/wiki/Koyuki_Ayase

title: slouch_hat
body:
A [b]slouch hat[/b] is a wide-brimmed felt or cloth [[hat]] most commonly worn as part of a [[military uniform]], mainly Australian, New Zealander or Rhodesian militaries. It is not always worn with a [[chin strap]] and the brim may be bent up. While it resembles the [[cowboy hat]], usage context is for military-themed outfits and settings.

Not to be confused with the [[boonie hat]] which appears to be lighter and softer.

h4. Examples

* !post #6045379
* !post #3555491

h4. See also

* [[campaign hat]]
* [[Tag Group:Headwear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Slouch hat":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slouch_hat

title: raised_curb
body:
A [b]curb[/b] or kerb, is the edge where a raised [[sidewalk]] or [[road]] median/central reservation meets a [[street]], park or other roadway. It consists of a line of stone/brick-like material.

title: crater
body:
A bowl-shaped pit [[on ground]] ([[planet]]ary surface). It is usually caused either by a [[meteor]]ite impact, powerful [[explosion]], or by geological activity on the planet. On [[earth (planet)|Earth]], craters are generally the results of [[volcano|volcanic]] [[eruption]]. 

h4. See also

* [[mushroom cloud]]
* [[wasteland]]
* [[valley]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Crater":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crater]

title: lava_lamp
body:
A type of decorative [[lamp]]. It consists of a transparent vessel containing colored wax mixture or translucent liquid. Its base contains a light bulb that heats up the liquid, causing it to slowly flow like lava.

title: chinese_walnut_cookie
body:
A popular and symbolically important [[cookie]] that is traditionally served to visitors during [[Chinese New Year]] celebrations.

Commonly found in regions such as Jiangxi, Beijing, Tianjin, and Shandong in China. Due to regional differences, its taste and preparation methods vary. The ingredients consist of walnuts, flour, sugar, lard, and eggs.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chinese walnut cookie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_walnut_cookie

title: schindler's_list
body:
A 1993 American epic historical drama film directed and produced by Steven Spielberg and written by Steven Zaillian. It is based on the 1982 novel [i]Schindler's Ark.[/i] The film follows Oskar Schindler, a German industrialist and former [[Nazi]] who saved more than a thousand mostly Polish–Jewish refugees from the Holocaust by employing them in his factories during [[World War II]]. 

The film is primarily shot in [[greyscale]] and well-known for iconic use of [[spot color]], the little girl in [[red coat]].

h4. External links

* "IMDb: Schindler's List":https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0108052/
* "Wikipedia: Schindler's List":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schindler%27s_List

title: hamanaka_midori
body:
[b]Hamanaka Midori[/b] is a secondary male character from [[Kokuhaku Jikkou Iinkai]].

He was born on January 23. He is a Sakuragaoka High School student in Class 1-1, and a member of the "Idiot Trio" consisting of himself, [[Enomoto Koutarou]], and [[Shibasaki Ken]].  

He has [[brown eyes]], [[messy hair|messy]] [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] , a small [[bandage on face|bandage on cheek]] near mouth, and [[ear piercing|pierced left ear]]. Midori used to wear his [[school uniform]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[sleeves rolled up]] and left the top [[partially unbuttoned]]. He wears a [[green shirt|green]] [[T-shirt]] underneath it, and wears his [[blazer]] tied around his [[jacket around waist|waist]]. When not in school, he wears large, clunky [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

Midori is described as the type of boy who is energetic and boisterous outside of a relationship, but inside he is more anxious, shy, and delicate. [spoiler]He acknowledges his insecurities when it comes to romance and seeks to become a much "cooler, manlier" person to stand by the person he loves.[/spoiler] Midori plays guitar in his school's music club. [spoiler]When he graduates from Sakuragaoka, Midori continues to pursue a musical career, writing his own songs and performing in a small-time band as a guitarist and lead singer.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "HoneyWorks Premium Live Wiki: Hamanaka Midori":https://hanipre.miraheze.org/wiki/Hamanaka_Midori
* "Confession Executive Committee Wiki: Hamanaka Midori":[https://lovecommittee.fandom.com/wiki/Midori_Hamanaka#Personality_and_Actions]

title: song_dynasty
body:
The [b]Song[/b] (宋) dynasty was an [[Chinese Empire|imperial dynasty of China]] that ruled from 960 to 1279. The dynasty was founded by Emperor Taizu of Song, who usurped the throne of the Later Zhou dynasty and went on to conquer the rest of the Ten Kingdoms, ending the [[Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms]] period. The Song often came into conflict with the contemporaneous Liao, Western Xia and Jin dynasties in northern China. After retreating to southern China following attacks by the Jin dynasty, the Song was eventually conquered by the [[Mongolia|Mongol-led]] [[Yuan dynasty]].

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Song dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Song_dynasty

title: yuan_dynasty
body:
The [b]Yuan dynasty[/b] (元朝), officially the [b]Great Yuan[/b] (大元) or [b]Yeke Yuwan Ulus[/b] (ᠶᠡᠬᠡᠶᠤᠸᠠᠨᠤᠯᠤᠰ), was a [[Mongolia|Mongol]]-led [[Chinese Empire|imperial dynasty of China]] and a successor state to the Mongol Empire after its division.

It was established by [[Kublai Khan]] (Emperor Shizu or Setsen Khan), the fifth khagan-emperor of the Mongol Empire from the Borjigin clan, and lasted from 1271 to 1368. In Chinese history, the Yuan dynasty followed the [[Song dynasty]] and preceded the [[Ming dynasty]].

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]
* [[Kublai Khan]]
* [[Mongolia]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Yuan dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuan_dynasty

title: long_life_vehicle
body:
Grumman Long-life Vehicle is a specially-designed [[van]] vehicle used by the US Postal Service and Canada Post.

It has a highly distinctive shape and (when employed by the USPS) white with blue and red paint scheme. Notably, LLV is designed to be [[right-hand drive]], unlike all other cars in North America. This gives it a distinctive arrangement of external mirrors around the vehicle, in order to provide the driver with adequate visibility in traffic.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Grumman LLV":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grumman_LLV]

title: mont_st-michel
body: A tidal island and mainland commune in Normandy, [[France]]. Together with its surrounding bay, Mont-Saint-Michel Bay, it has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1979 for its unique aesthetic and importance as a medieval Christian site. Its abbey, Mont-Saint-Michel Abbey, is a popular pilgrimage site and has been a French monument historique since 1862. h4. External links * "Official Tourist Website":[https://www.ot-montsaintmichel.com/en/] * "Wikipedia: Mont-Saint-Michel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mont-Saint-Michel]

title: radiation
body:
An emanation of hazardous electromagnetic energy.

In media, it is often stereotypically depicted as green gas or ooze. A more realistic depiction would be a blue or purple haze/glow around the emitting object, to represent the ionization of the surrounding air and/or [[Cherenkov radiation]] caused by extremely radioactive objects or [[film grain]] from the exposure of radiation on a camera lens. An artistic representation may be stylized "rays" coming from this object.

h4. See also

* [[Cherenkov radiation]]
* [[demon core]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Radiation":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radiation

title: miyune_bun
body:
English-speaking [[indie virtual YouTuber]]. She was designed and rigged by [[Sugiura Rippu]].

Her first model has [[black hair]], [[blue eyes|blue]] to [[aqua eyes|aqua]] eyes, a brown [[blazer]], a white [[collared shirt]], an [[aqua ribbon|aqua]] [[neck ribbon|neck]] and [[hair ribbon]]s. She shared this non-exclusive model with fellow VTuber Luluna Rina as well as a Japanese virtual weather broadcaster.

Her custom second model, also designed by Hikoura Kaede, has [[blue hair|blue]] [[twintails]], [[hair ornament]]s, and [[blue eyes|eyes]], a futuristic [[white dress]] with black outlines and blue highlights, [[bare shoulders]] and a [[center opening]]. She also wears [[black gloves]] and [[black thighhighs|black]] [[detached leggings]]

body:
This [[Hatsune Miku]] design is illustrated by [[Gozen4ji]] with Nasos as the concept designer for [i]Tsuyu[/i] theme, a theme for Cospa papercraft doll in 2011. Can be called Jito Miku or Zito Miku.

[i]Tsuyu[/i] is the rainy summer period in Japan, usually from late-May to early-July. [i]Jito[/i] is taken from a Japanese expression [i]Jito-Jito[/i], which means very humid or rain that feels damp and long lasting.

title: tiefling
body:
A tiefling is a fictional humanoid race introduced by the [[Dungeons & Dragons]] tabletop role-playing game. They are described as "human-based planetouched, native outsiders that were infused with the touch of the fiendish planes (typically devils)"

They are essentially [[demon girl]]s and [[demon boy|boys]]. They typically have e.g. [[demon horns|horns]] and a [[demon tail|tail]], and atypically [[colored skin]] (e.g. [[red skin|red]], [[pink skin|pink]], [[purple skin|purple]], or [[black skin|jet black]]).

* "Wikipedia: Tiefling":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiefling]

title: drawcrowd_sample
body:
An [[image sample]] from Drawcrowd.

Drawcrowd does not work with the bookmarklet and you must manually alter part of the image URL (typically [b]/large/[/b]) to [b]/original/[/b]. The download and expand buttons on Drawcrowd are deceptive in that the original is usually kept hidden to mitigate bandwidth costs. If the [b]/original/[/b] returns a [b]file not found[/b] error, then the [b]/large/[/b] image is accepted as the original.

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples or delete them. See [[image sample]] for more information. See [[howto:drawcrowd]] for how to upload images from Drawcrowd correctly.

h4. See also

* [[Bad Drawcrowd ID]]

title: deviantart_sample
body:
An [[image sample]] from DeviantArt.

DeviantArt image URLs sometimes contain either the string "200H" or "PRE". These URLs point to scaled down images, not the full size. 200H URLs point to small thumbnails, scaled down to 200 pixels. PRE URLs point to medium-sized samples, displayed on the art page by default if the full-sized image is too large. If you remove the "200H/" or "PRE/" parts from one of these sample URLs, the resulting URL will point to the full-sized version instead.

This tag should be used when the image uploaded to Danbooru is one of these scaled down versions.

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples or delete them. See [[image sample]] for more information. See [[howto:deviantart]] for how to upload from DeviantArt correctly.

h4. See also

* [[Bad DeviantArt ID]]

title: tumblr_sample
body:
An [[image sample]] from Tumblr.

Tumblr images carry one of multiple available file name suffixes: 

* [code]_75sq[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_100[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_250[/code] (sample)
* [code]_400[/code] (sample)
* [code]_500[/code] (sample; sometimes original, see forum #132817)
* [code]_500h[/code] (sample; height-bounded)
* [code]_540[/code] (sample)
* [code]_640[/code] (sample)
* [code]_1280[/code] (sample; sometimes original)
* [code]_raw[/code] (defunct)

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples or delete them. See [[image sample]] for more information. See [[howto:tumblr]] on how to upload from Tumblr correctly.

h4. See also

* [[Bad Tumblr ID]]

title: artstation_sample
body:
An [[image sample]] from ArtStation.

An ArtStation sample can either have lower image dimensions, or have the same dimensions but truncated bit-by-bit quality.

ArtStation formerly had a much more complicated image sampling issue, which can be referred back to by looking at previous revisions of this article or viewing the legacy procedure for avoiding samples at [[howto:artstation]]. Now a user may errantly upload from image URLs including "/small/" or "/medium/" rather than the correct "/large/" which would be replaceable by a moderator or by uploading the unsampled version and manually deleting the sample. There was formerly a fourth "/original/" which was manually accessible to save bandwidth. ArtStation terminated access to such files reportedly also to save bandwidth.

h4. See also

* [[Bad ArtStation ID]]

title: a-pose
body:
A pose shaped like the capital letter "A", where the arms are held straight out and angled downwards from the sides of the body.

This is more relaxed than a [[T-pose]] or [[outstretched arms]], but less relaxed than [[arms at sides]] where the arms simply hang against the torso due to gravity.

You often see this pose in a few contexts, for example:

* A character showing off an outfit.
* A character posed similarly to a [[Sailor Moon]] magical-girl style [[transformation]] scene or the like where the character appears to be relaxed, but floating.

The name comes from 3D modelling as an alternative to the more common [[T-pose]].  The A-pose allows for the shoulders to be modeled and textured in a more natural position, and the defined angle can aid in rigging.

h4. Related tags

h6. Larger angle

* [[T-pose]]
* [[outstretched arms]]
* [[airplane arms]]
* [[spread arms]]

h6. Smaller angle

* [[Arms at sides]]
* [[v arms]] (arms point inward towards body center)

h4. See also

* [[w arms]] (arms can either point inward or outward, but with forearms raised)
* [[Tag Group:Posture]]

h4. External links

* "Discussion of T-pose vs A-pose":https://polycount.com/discussion/202303/to-t-pose-or-not-to-t-pose
* "Discussion of T-pose vs A-pose (in Japanese)":https://itami.info/tech/3d/a-pose-or-t-pose.html

title: panty_mask
body:
Wearing [[panties]] on the face like a [[mask]].

This is a common comedic gag for characters portrayed as [[pervert]]s (either canonically or in fan-based memes), or those that engage in [[underwear theft]].  Common culprits featuring this situation include [[Akemi Homura]] and [[Hentai Kamen]] and [[Kajou Ayame]] (as [[Blue Snow]]), who both feature this as part of their [[costume]]s.

This is typically shown as the panties being wrapped around the whole of the head (see post #912795, post #1021602) with the crotch of the panties covering the mouth and nose of the wearer, the waistband around the top of the head and chin, and the wearer's ears protruding through the leg holes, securing the sides of the waist band.

Other methods also exist, where the top of the waistband crosses below the wearer's eyes (see post #4082406, post #3944133).  This form better evokes the form of a [[mouth mask]] and seems to have become more common in response to the [[coronavirus pandemic]] of 2020.

Other variations can exist (e.g. post #3308317, post #1717051, post #65772). This tag is applicable so long as the face is largely involved, and the panties aren't simply worn on the top of the head like a [[hat]], with the waistband around the forehead.  [[Panties on head]] covers both cases, and is implicated by this tag.

For the converse of this tag, where a [[mouth mask]] is worn over the crotch as if they were [[panties]], use the tag [[mask panties]].

h4. See also

* [[Hentai Kamen]]
* [[Blue Snow]]
* [[panties on head]]
* [[mask panties]]
* [[mask bikini]]

title: roto_(dq3)
body:
The hero in [[Dragon Quest III]]. While the game gave a choice to play a male or female hero, the sprite used was the same. Thus the female hero is often drawn [[androgynous]] in fan art. Nevertheless the [[genderswap]] tag does not apply here. In the remakes of the game, there are different sprites for the male and female versions of Roto.

Note that "Roto" is a title more than anything else, given to the greatest of heroes in Alefgard. The hero became Roto at the very end of the game, after saving the underworld (Alefgard) by defeating [[Zoma]]. They would later become the ancestor of the [[Dragon quest i|DQ1]] and [[Dragon quest ii|DQ2]] heroes.

In English translations, aside from a brief stint as [b]"Loto"[/b], the title has been consistently translated as [b]"Erdrick"[/b], used in the original NES translation of the first game.

He (that is, the [[hero (dq3)|male hero]]), along with the heroes of [i][[hero (dq4)|IV]][/i], [i][[hero (dq8)|VIII]][/i] and [i][[hero (dq11)|XI]][/i], was chosen to be a fighter on [[super smash bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]]'s first fighters pass. They are collectively Fighter #72, with Eleven as the "face".

h4. See also

* [[Hero (DQ3)]]  [tn]Roto when depicted as male[/tn]
* [[Heroine (DQ3)]] [tn]Roto when depicted as female[/tn]
* [[Arihara Yuuna (hanauna)|]]

title: heroine_(dq3)
body:
The female form of [[Roto (dq3)|]], the hero and protagonist of [[Dragon Quest III]].

In the game, the player designates the character as either male or female.  Originally, the [[sprite]] used was the same regardless of this choice. Even as a female, the hero is often drawn [[androgynous]]ly or as a [[tomboy]] in fan art (with e.g. notably [[short hair]]). Use this tag when it is clear (e.g. by presence of [[breasts]] or other well-defined sexual characteristics or activities) that the artist intended for this iteration of Roto to be female.

h4. See also

* [[Roto (dq3)|]]
* [[Hero (DQ3)]] [tn]Roto, when depicted as a male.[/tn]
* [[Arihara yuuna (hanauna)|]] [tn]A specific long-haired original character based on the female version of Roto that has diverged and can be considered a separate character.[/tn]

title: hero_(dq3)

In the game, the player designates the character as either male or female.  Originally, the [[sprite]] used was the same regardless of this choice.  Use this tag when it is clear (e.g. by a notably masculine appearance, or the presence of well-defined sexual characteristics or activities) that the artist intended for this iteration of Roto to be male.

title: marl_kingdom
body:
A trilogy of role playing video games developed by [[Nippon Ichi]] for the Playstation and Playstation 2. The games are as follows:

* [[Rhapsody]], released for Playstation in 1998, and was the only one to be localized. Although popular in Japan, its girlish elements didn't appeal to the western audience.
* [[Little Princess]], released for Playstation in 1999, then made available for download on the Playstation 3 and Playstation Portable via the Playstation Store.
* Tenshi no Present, released for Playstation 2 in 2000. This game isn't tagged since it is just a collection of side stories relating to the previous two games.

title: gauge
body:

Examples of these can be found on post #1483841 (strapped to the girl's thigh) or post #1665641 (on the front of the aircraft). These sometimes take the form of a thermometer-like measurement bar, or a [[dial]].

For video game interfaces that indicate energy, health, progress, etc., see [[health bar]].

For the wide-diameter piercings colloquially called "gauges", see [[plug (piercing)]].

title: scared
body:
A character who is in an emotional state of fear.

This can be used in either a humorous or serious fashion. Characteristics include [[trembling]], wide eyes, [[tears]], [[cowering]], and in extreme cases, contracted pupils and a general sense of great danger approaching the character.

For jumpy, sudden scares (such as "BOO!" moments), use the [[surprised]] tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #324268
* !post #448476
* !post #305421
* !post #429003
* !post #425505

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Face tags]]
* [[disgust]]
* [[turn pale]]
* [[paralysis]]

title: petals
body:

For example, an image with a fully-intact red flower should be tagged [[red flower]], not [[red petals]].

title: pectorals

h4. Exposure
