title: ichido_dake_demo_koukai_shitemasu
body:
A [[yuri]] manga about a landlady and her tenant.

Kozuka Chiyo (the tenant) has been unemployed, her rent is 3 months behind and all of her saving have been spent on beers. One day, the landlady comes to Kozuka with an offer: whenever Kozuka do something she like, she'll tick off a box to reduce the remaining money which Kozuka is still owed, until all of the boxes are ticked or all of the remaining owed money is paid.
other_names: 一度だけでも後悔してます

title: terada_tera_(style)
body:
Artwork [[style parody|parodying the style]] of [[Terada Tera]], often that of characters designed for the music videos of songs written by [[NayutalieN]] and sung by Nanawo Akari.

The common features of this style include notably [[chibi]] proportions with large [[jitome]] or [[upturned eyes]] with small pupils (sometimes bordering on [[slit pupils]]) and flat shading.

h4. See also
* [[Style Parody]]
* [[Datenshi-chan (nanawo akari)|]]
* [[Discommunication Alien]]
* [[Turing Love]] (specifically the animated music video)
* [[NayutalieN]]

title: miles_morales'_sketchbook_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] that references a scene from [[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]] (and was featured in teasers for the movie) where [[Spider-Gwen]] picks up and flips through [[Miles Morales]]' [[sketchbook]] (seeing drawings of herself in the original).

In the meme, the drawings are typically replaced with material for pool #4229 (Perversion of Canon).

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Are These Your Drawings? / Gwen Finds Miles Morales' Drawings":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/are-these-your-drawings-gwen-finds-miles-morales-drawings]

title: skirt_as_blanket_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] started on Twitter by artist [[Raya (yuri15923)]] in June 2024.

It is a [[2koma]] format comic with the first panel depicting one character [[sleeping]] with their [[head on table|head on a table]], with another character seeming to be [[covering with blanket|tucking them in]] gently with a blanket.  The second panel indicates that the "blanket" is actually the sleeping character's [[skirt lift|skirt]] which is being [[lifting another's clothes|lifted]] resulting in [[assisted exposure]].

Because of this, it generally falls into pool #2278 (Almost Heart-Warming) territory, and could be considered [[bait and switch]].

h4. Origin

* !post #7741409

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Skirt as Blanket":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/skirt-as-blanket]

title: monkey_grip
body: A distinctive and uncommon space cut out in the upper body of an [[electric guitar]]. The space creates a handy carrying grip and is formed to fit comfortably within the curved fingers of the player's fist. Usually restricted to certain models of Ibanez electric guitars, e.g. GEM.

title: horigotatsu
body:
A low [[table]] often seen in Japanese [[restaurant]]s with a sunken recessed area beneath it where one could put their feet. This allows one to sit as one would in a traditional [[tatami]] room, or in a more traditionally western manner. Such tables may have a built in charcoal stove or heat source beneath them.

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Horigotatsu":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E6%8E%98%E3%82%8A%E3%81%94%E3%81%9F%E3%81%A4]

title: influenza_virus_(hataraku_saibou)
body:
A [[personification|personified]] version of the [[influenza]] [[virus]] as seen in [[Hataraku Saibou]].

They take the form of [[green skin|green-skinned]] [[zombie|zombified]] versions of the [[common cell (hataraku saibou)|]] mob characters.  As such they are typically all male, have [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[black hair]], and wear [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]]s and [[black pants]]. Up close, their eyes have [[no pupils]], and on their heads they wear a round [[red headwear|red]] [[hat]]-like cap with white spikey bits poking out of it representing the virion itself.

h4. External links

* "Cells at Work Wiki: Influenza Virus":[https://cellsatwork.fandom.com/wiki/Influenza_Virus]

title: anata_horuko
body:
An [[original]] moe character designed by [[yucchi_(kotoba_zombie)]] and belonging to "Zest-System":[https://www.zest-system.com/], a company that appears to do graphics design, signage, and light construction.

The character was designed to be used in [[warning sign]]s for the construction industry (e.g. "do not enter").  The character carries a shovel and her name could be read something along the lines of: "Holefield Digger" which fits her purpose.

For some reason a handful of artists on Twitter and Pixiv apparently found her cute and started drawing her, despite a stern warning in Zest-System's catalogue not to use their characters.

She is a [[tomboy]]-like character with [[brown eyes]], [[short_hair|short]] [[messy hair|messy]] [[brown hair]] sometimes with an [[ahoge]].  She wears a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[camisole]], [[green_pants|green]] [[cargo pants|cargo]] [[pants]], and a [[brown belt]], she also sometimes carries a [[shovel]].

h4. External links

* "Zest-System's catalogue":[https://online.pubhtml5.com/iokx/trra/#p=170] showing products featuring Anata Horuko.
* "Twitter: #穴田ほるこ":[https://twitter.com/search?q=穴田ほるこ] - Anata Horuko's hashtag on Twitter
* "Twitter: Photo of Anata Horuko's 'Do not enter' sign being used publically":[https://twitter.com/aliceonthethigh/status/1426915647733125124]

title: tsukuyomi_shirabe_(another)
body:
An alternate form of [[Tsukuyomi Shirabe]] in [[Senki Zesshou Symphogear XD Unlimited]] that comes from a parallel world.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[bangs]] in a [[bob cut]], and wears a [[pink_shirt|pink]] [[dress shirt]] under a [[lab coat]], [[black_shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] and [[black thighhighs]] featuring [[zettai ryouiki]].  She commonly wears her [[coke-bottle glasses]] [[eyewear_on_head|on her head]].
other_names: へいこうせかいのしらべ

title: shrink_wrap
body:
A plastic film that is used to wrap something (very often a product for sale).

When heat is applied to it, it shrinks to conform to the product inside. This is often done to hold food onto a [[tray]] in [[food packaging]], or when done to another [[container]] (such as a [[medicine]] [[box]], [[cd case]], or [[video game]] [[box]]) to be tamper-evident for safety or prevent theft. It is also used on [[book]]s and [[manga (object)|]] either to prevent minors from viewing adult content or to prevent shoppers from reading in a store without purchasing.

It is later revealed [spoiler]that he has become a manipulated [[cyborg]] puppet of [[Gargoyle (Nadia)|]], and was the [[father and son|son]] of [[Nemo (Nadia)|]] and [[brother and sister|brother]] of [[Nadia la Arwall]].[/spoiler]

title: kitchen_timer
body:
A [[countdown timer]] used in a [[kitchen]] while [[cooking]]. 

Also known as an "egg timer" or a "pomodoro timer" (specifically for a tomato-shaped variety).  These can take the form of small [[hourglass]]es / sand timers, as mechanical wind-up devices with bells, or more modern digital timers with [[seven-segment display]]s.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Egg timer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egg_timer]

This character was born female, but uses male pronouns and has the ability to transform into multiple forms including initially that of a young boy with [[grey hair|silver hair]], later they are seen in their original true form as a girl with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. They are an altered [[clone]] of [[Sicks (Neuro)|]].

h4. External links

* "Nougami Neuro Wiki: X":[https://nogamineuro.fandom.com/wiki/X]

title: robot_(manabi_kangaeru_rekishi)_(meme)
body:
For the original robot character, see [[Robot (Manabi Kangaeru Rekishi)]].

Around May 2024, a [[meme]] featuring [[Robot (Manabi Kangaeru Rekishi)]] spread on X (formerly Twitter) where this robot would make insensitive comments on various people and situations without reading the room, and became a popular joke format.  In this meme form, the robot has been called "ノンデリロボ" / "Indelicate Robot", "鬼畜ロボ" / "Brutal Robot", "ロボカス" / "Robo-Trash", or simply "例のロボ" / "That Certain Robot" among other things.  In this meme format, the robot typically says a phrase ending in "...ばいいのに" / "It's still fine even if..."

h4. Examples

* !asset #21721862

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Robot (Manabi Kangaeru Rekishi)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C%E3%83%83%E3%83%88(%E5%AD%A6%E3%81%B3%E8%80%83%E3%81%88%E3%82%8B%E6%AD%B4%E5%8F%B2)]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Indelicate Robot":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%8E%E3%83%B3%E3%83%87%E3%83%AA%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Robo-Trash":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C%E3%82%AB%E3%82%B9]
* "The meme on Twitter/X":[https://x.com/search?q=%E4%BE%8B%E3%81%AE%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C]
other_names: ロボット(学び考える歴史)

title: robot_(manabi_kangaeru_rekishi)
body:
A small blue [[robot]] with a round head with a [[radio antenna|antenna]] on top and a cylindrical body with a [[?|question mark]] on it. It was featured in the middle school history textbook entitled "Manabi Kangaeru Rekishi" / "History to Learn and Think About".

It doesn't have an officially set name and is simply referred to as "Robot". It is has also been known as the Impression-Tweeting Robot or the Textbook Robot.

Its appearance is meant to be that of a very ordinary robot that would be likely to appear in educational media, but and meant to have the trait of "having and amazing memory but not to know much about humans".

In the textbook, the robot repeatedly makes remarks about historical events based on modern values, disregarding the historical context and religious views of the time, which could be taken as provocative. Its non-robotic, uncharacteristically cynical, and brutish behavior has garnered mysterious attention and become a topic of discussion.

Around May 2024, [[robot_(manabi_kangaeru_rekishi)_(meme)|a meme featuring this character]] spread on X (formerly Twitter) where this robot would make insensitive comments on various people and situations without reading the room, and became a popular joke format.  In this meme form, the robot has been called "ノンデリロボ" / "Indelicate Robot", "鬼畜ロボ" / "Brutal Robot", "ロボカス" / "Robo-Trash", or simply "例のロボ" / "That Certain Robot" among other things.  In this meme format, the robot typically says a phrase ending in "...ばいいのに" / "It's still fine even if..."

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21721862

h4. See also

* [[Robot (Manabi Kangaeru Rekishi) (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Robot (Manabi Kangaeru Rekishi)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C%E3%83%83%E3%83%88(%E5%AD%A6%E3%81%B3%E8%80%83%E3%81%88%E3%82%8B%E6%AD%B4%E5%8F%B2)]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Indelicate Robot":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%8E%E3%83%B3%E3%83%87%E3%83%AA%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Robo-Trash":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C%E3%82%AB%E3%82%B9]
* "The meme on Twitter/X":[https://x.com/search?q=%E4%BE%8B%E3%81%AE%E3%83%AD%E3%83%9C]
other_names: ロボット(学び考える歴史)

title: kurose_kana_(dancho)
body:
An [[original]] character of the artist [[Dancho (Dancyo)]] who has featured in some of their doujins.

She is a meek, quiet girl who frequently ends up being undressed and humiliated by others, but she doesn't particularly resist it.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[bangs]], [[brown eyes]], and is petite with [[small breasts]].  She frequently wears her [[school uniform]] which consists of a [[white_shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] under a [[yellow cardigan]] with a [[blue_bowtie|blue]] [[plaid_bowtie|plaid]] [[bowtie]], a [[grey_skirt|grey]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]] and [[black pantyhose]].

title: open-bust_leotard
body:
A type of [[leotard]] that became popular in the 1980s as part of the [[aerobics]] fashion craze at the time.

As the name suggests, unlike most leotards, this garnment does not cover the chest and instead only features straps that come up from the waist to the shoulders, similar to a [[slingshot swimsuit]] with a leotard bottom.  This type of leotard is also always [[sleeveless]]. It is intended to be worn with a [[shirt]] or two (often a [[crop top]] or bandeau) above and/or beneath it.

This differs from [[breastless leotard]] which is a type of lingerie or erotic-wear intended to leave the breasts exposed, and is usually cut differently (sometimes omitting the straps altogether or combining them into a halterneck).

h4. Examples

* !post #5600396
* !post #5406426: (center)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Leotard (Crossover to fashion activewear)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leotard#Crossover_to_fashion_activewear]

title: lina_rei
body:
An alternative reality version of [[Ayanami Rei]] that appears in the final episode of [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], [i]"The Beast that Shouted 'I' at the Heart of the World"[/i].

She appears in a different [[school uniform]] than normal (with a [[brown sweater vest|brown]] or [[yellow sweater vest]] , [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[dress shirt]], [[red necktie]], and [[black skirt|black]] or [[grey skirt]]).

She also has a much more emotive and assertive personality than Rei typically has.  Because the [[scene reference|scene]] she appears in is a parody of the stereotypical "[[late for school|crash into the girl hurrying to get to school]]" meme, she is often depicted running with a piece of [[toast in mouth|toast in her mouth]].

Because Rei shares a voice actress with [[Lina Inverse]] from [[Slayers]] (which originally came out about the same time as Evangelion), and because this alternate version of Rei seemed to share Lina's personality and thus sounded very similar, the Japanese fan community nicknamed this version of her as "Lina Rei".

h4. Appearance

* !post #469854

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Lina Rei":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%AA%E3%83%8A%E3%83%AC%E3%82%A4]

Sometimes these would be scientific demonstrations, sometimes elaborate choreographed performances (as was the original viral internet video), sometimes [[prank]]s.

title: light_gun
body:
A specialized [[game controller]], usually shaped like a [[gun]] and used to play target-shooting [[video game]]s.

The light gun is so called because in its earliest forms, it used light sensors inside the shell to track "hits" on the targets. Light guns have been popular in arcade games such as Time Crisis, Point Blank, Virtua Cop and House of the Dead. They have also been popular in early home console games such as Duck Hunt, in addition to more modern home ports of arcade classics.

Traditionally, light gun controllers have been wired and permanently connected on arcade games; their home counterparts were wired and unpluggable. Nowadays, home light guns use [[wireless]] Bluetooth connections.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Light gun shooter":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light_gun_shooter

This tag is for the object itself, whether or not it is currently possessed or animated.  If it is possessed by Souta (talking, walking, blushing, etc), then additionally use the tag [[Munakata Souta (Chair)]].  This chair appears in almost the entire film [[damaged]] with one leg missing. It has eyes carved into its backrest.

Most game characters have versions in other media (anime and manga). Sometimes, you can use this tag to search for the game version of a character, specifically. Examples of searches...

A few other character tags are strictly game-only. Examples: [[Mint (Pokemon)]], [[Wes (pokemon)|]].

title: sazae-san_food_gag_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] wherein a character appears [[dancing]] in a split and hollowed out object (usually a [[fruit]], [[vegetable]], or other [[food]]), standing in the bottom half, and holding the upper half [[carrying_overhead|over their head]] in a "[[\o/]]" sort of pose.

This is [[parody|]]ing the end of the opening sequence of the long-running anime [[Sazae-san]], which since April 1971 has featured [[Fuguta Sazae|Fuguta Sazae's]] cat [[Tama (Sazae-san)|]] popping out of an fruit and dancing in this manner.  She and her whole family would also do so.  

The featured foods would also vary over time and with the seasons (e.g. a [[tomato]] and [[peewah]] for spring; [[watermelon]] and [[melon]] for summer; [[persimmon]] and [[chestnut]] for autumn; and an [[apple]] and [[mikan]] for winter).  An irregular version of the gag where Tama pops out early has been dubbed "フライングタマ" / "Flying Tama" in Japan.

An example of this gag in the OP with the family popping out of an apple and Tama popping out of a mikan can be seen "here":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IUgxKutV_p0]. An example from April 1971 before the standardized seasonal fruit were set can be seen "here":[https://youtu.be/BW1XgYm_AiM?t=8], with Tama and the family both popping out of [[strawberry|strawberries]].

h4. External links

* "An article describing the Opening Gag (in Japanese)":[https://premium-goma.com/sazae-flyingtama/]
* "Initial appearance of the 'Flying Tama' variant of the gag in the Sazae-san opening":[https://twitter.com/Sazaesan_survey/status/1127562860714848261]

title: squeeze_bottle
body:
A flexible [[plastic bottle]] designed to [[squeezing|squeeze]] or [[squirting_liquid|squirt]] the product inside through the top.

Frequently used for dispensing [[lotion]] (like [[sunscreen]]) or [[condiment]]s (such as [[ketchup]], [[mustard]], [[syrup]] or [[mayonnaise]]). It is also sometimes known as a "squirt bottle".

title: tangle_the_lemur
body:
Major character in the [[sonic the hedgehog (idw)|Sonic IDW comic series]]. A [[lemur girl]] with a long tail from Spiral Hill Village and the current leader of the modern incarnation of the Diamond Cutters. She was designed to be a [[tomboy]]ish adventure companion for [[sonic the hedgehog|Sonic]].

She is commonly paired with [[Whisper the Wolf]], and while the writers of the comics support the pairing, it can only be implied in canon rather than confirmed due to Sega mandates around romance.

She made her game debut in the mobile games [[Sonic Dash]] and [[Sonic Forces: Speed Battle]].

h4. External links
* "Sonic Wiki Zone: Tangle the Lemur":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Tangle_the_Lemur
other_names: タングル・ザ・リーマー

title: whisper_the_wolf
body:
Major character in the [[sonic the hedgehog (idw)|Sonic IDW comic series]]. A soft-spoken [[wolf girl]] with trauma from her past in the original Diamond Cutters prior to the events of the series. She uses a special weapon designed to use the power of [[Wisp (sonic)|]]s.

She is commonly paired with [[Tangle the Lemur]], and while the writers of the comics support the pairing, it can only be implied in canon rather than confirmed due to Sega mandates around romance.

She made her game debut in the mobile games [[Sonic Dash]] and [[Sonic Forces: Speed Battle]].

h4. External links
* "Sonic Wiki Zone: Whisper the Wolf":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Whisper_the_Wolf

body:

title: hanya_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

One of the judges of the Xianzhou Luofu's Ten-Lords Commission. Ordained by the Ten-Lords and wielding the authority of the Oracle Brush, she reads the multitudes of human sins and transgressions, then issues punishments and karmic retribution.

She is the sister of [[Xueyi (Honkai: Star Rail)|]].

h4. Profile

One of the judges of the Ten-Lords Commission. Of the four duties of a judge (detention, imprisonment, punishment, and interrogation), Hanya is charged with the last task.

She specializes in reading the karma and sins of criminals, and records their crimes and punishments with the Oracle Brush.

As she spends her days using dreams to predict karmic offenses and has to endure the torrential flood of information regarding the mara-strucks' actions, she has long become dull to all things in the world.

Only when she operates with her sister and fellow judge, Xueyi, will Hanya momentarily reveal her true nature.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6723984

title: yukong_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

She is the Helm Master of the Xianzhou Alliance's Sky-Faring Commission.

h4. Profile

The Xianzhou Luofu's Head of the Sky-Faring Commission is gentle, yet seasoned and authoritative.

Having been a pilot since young, she had become the commission's head with her outstanding combat achievements, yet she no longer flies due to a particularly brutal battle.

Now, her shine had already dimmed as she shifted her focus to official duties, but she is always seen guiding the course of the Luofu.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7690458

title: yotsuyu_goe_brutus
body:
A sadistic [[Hyur]]an woman serving as one of the main antagonists in [[Final Fantasy XIV]]'s [i]Stormblood[/i] expansion. 

She has [[green eyes]], [[long hair|long]], [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. Her attire consists of an [[off shoulder]] [[black kimono]], [[yellow sash|yellow]] [[obi]] complete with an [[obijime]] and visible [[obiage]], and [[okobo]] sandals. Her hair is adorned with a [[epiphyllum|"queen of the night"]] [[hair flower|flower]] and [[bat hair ornament|bat-shaped sticks]]. She also wears a [[black collar|black]] [[lace collar]] around her neck. Usually seen holding a [[kiseru]].

Drawing on her storyline, Yotsuyu's character is often symbolized by the [[full moon]] and [[spider lily]] flower in fanart. [spoilers]A notable element of this is her transformation into the lunar primal [[Tsukuyomi (ff14)|Tsukuyomi]].[/spoiler]

h4. Official art

title: doki_doki_majo_shinpan
body:
Doki Doki Majo Shinpan! (どきどき魔女神判!, lit. "Thump-Thump Witch Judgement", or more accurately translated as "Heart-Pounding Magical Investigation") is a game developed by [[SNK]] Playmore for [[Nintendo DS]].

The player assumes the role of a junior high school student who is asked by an angel to locate a [[witch]] that has sneaked into her school. In order to find the witch, she must search the suspects' bodies for a "witch mark." The preferred method is by using touch (using the stylus to guide her hands).

A sequel titled Doki Doki Majo Shinpan 2 Duo was released 31 July 2008, and a third game titled Doki Majo Plus was released on July 30, 2009.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Doki Doki Majo Shinpan!":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doki_Doki_Majo_Shinpan!

title: tsuburaya_eiji
body:
Japanese special effects director, filmmaker, and cinematographer. A co-creator of the [[godzilla_(series)|Godzilla]] and [[ultra_series|Ultraman]] franchises, he is considered one of the most important and influential figures in the history of cinema. 

And founder of [[Tsuburaya Productions]], or TsuPro for short.

Known as the "Father of [[Tokusatsu]]".

title: soldering
body:
The act of joining two [[metal]]lic surfaces together by [[melting]] a metal or alloy (referred to as solder) with a lower melting point into the space between them. This can be done by heating both the solder and the surfaces using a [[soldering iron]], a heat gun, or a [[fire|flame]]. Differs from [[welding]] in that the metals to be joined are themselves not heated all the way to melting point.

When higher melting point solder is used, it is referred to as "brazing".

title: queen_of_hearts_symbol
body:
A [[heart]] symbol, commonly red, with the letter "Q" in it. A common symbol of "bleached" content.

It displays a sole sexual preference of white men. Often includes submissive elements.

Not to be confused with the playing card [[Queen of Hearts (playing card)]].

Opposite of [[Queen of Spades symbol]].

title: queen_of_spades_symbol
body:
Typically a symbol featuring a black [[spade (shape)|spade]] with a Q, but can also be the chain of letters QoS. This symbol indicates an [[interracial]] sexual preference for [[dark-skinned male|black men]].

Not to be confused with the [[playing card]] [[Queen of Spades]].

Opposite of [[Queen of Hearts Symbol]].

title: mayumi_(pop'n_music)
body:
[i]A girl who loves her hometown.
She has a close relationship with her parents and spends her time practicing her singing and dancing.[/i]

A Okinawan girl who uses a [[bowl]] as a hat. She is inspired by folk heroes and traditional Japanese culture.

title: seal_(animal)
body:
A large, fish-eating mammal that has a round body, sleek fur, and lives near the sea, usually in cold climates.

Not to be confused with the [[sea lion]]. The difference between a seal and a sea lion is that a sea lion can walk on land.

title: scheherazade_(masterwork_apocalypse)
body:
Character from [[Masterwork Apocalypse]].

[b]Origin:[/b] One Thousand and One Nights, a collection of Middle Eastern folk tales compiled in Arabic during the Islamic Golden Age. The work was collected over many centuries by various authors, translators, and scholars across West, Central and South Asia, and North Africa, so there's no definitive version. What is common to all the versions of the Nights is the initial frame story of the ruler Shahryār and his wife Scheherazade and the framing device incorporated throughout the tales themselves.
[b]Japanese voice actress:[/b] [[Iguchi Yuka]].

title: war_of_the_worlds
body:
[b]The War of the Worlds[/b] (宇宙戦争) is a classic, very famous and influential [[science fiction]] novel published by English writer H. G. Wells in 1898. 

Is the first person narrative of an unnamed protagonist's odyssey in Surrey and London as [[Earth (planet)|]] is invaded and devastated by [[alien]]s from planet [[Mars (planet)|]]. Written in the period of 1895–1897, the book is one of the earliest realistic stories that details a conflict between mankind and a more advanced and hostile extraterrestrial race. 

At the time of publication it was classified as a scientific romance. The War of the Worlds has been both popular (having never gone out of print) and influential, spawning half a dozen feature films, radio dramas, a record album, various comic book adaptations, a television series, and sequels or parallel stories by other authors. It is one of the first works of fiction known to depict alien [[mecha]].

It has even influenced the work of [[real life]] [[scientist]]s, most notably American rocket scientist [[Robert Hutchings Goddard]].

h4. See also

* [[Tripod (mecha)]]

title: tripod_(mecha)
body:
A fictional [[alien]] [[walker (robot)|]] mecha from the novel "The [[War of the Worlds]]" published in 1898.

It is a giant three legged [[robot]] piloted by a Martian and armed with a devastating energy cannon (the "heat ray") and several mechanical tentacles. This machine is perhaps the first example of an alien [[mecha]] in the [[science fiction]] genre.

The [[Big Zam]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] was inspired by this walker.

title: kusanagi_(clone)
body:
One of the characters from [[The King of Fighters]] series of fighting games developed by [[SNK]]. He is voiced by [[Iwata Mitsuo]].

He was believed by many fans to have been originally created as a NESTS experiment, mainly a clone of [[Kusanagi Kyou]], due to a special intro he has with [[K9999]]. This introduction is, in fact, an homage to [[AKIRA (manga)|]] as both K9999 and Kusanagi have the same voice actors as [[Shima Tetsuo|Tetsuo]] and [[Kaneda Shoutarou (akira)|Kaneda]] respectively.

His actual backstory in [[the King of Fighters 2003|KOF 2003]] reveals him to be a product of [[Kagura Chizuru]]'s magic, used to test the strength of the tournament's contestants. His evil appearance is possibly due to the fact that he was created by Chizuru while under the control of [[Mukai (KoF)|]] (the leader of the KOF 2003 operation) and [[Botan (kof)|]] (the puppeteer controlling Chizuru).

title: kusanagi_kyou
body:
草薙 京 (くさなぎ きょう)

One of the main characters in [[SNK|SNK's]] [[The King of Fighters|King of Fighters]] video game series, Kusanagi Kyou was first introduced in [[The King of Fighters '94]] as the leader of the Japan team. He is the rival of [[Yagami Iori]] and the boyfriend of [[Kushinada Yuki|Yuki]].

He was first introduced as a cocky delinquent high school student who is the heir of his clan, Kusanagi, one of the three clans that sealed the legendary snake entity, [[Orochi (KOF)|Orochi]], 1,800 years ago. His clan wields pyrokinetic powers, an inherited power that few members obtain. They, along with the [[Yagami Iori|Yasakani]] and [[Kagura Chizuru|Yata]] clans, keep one of the three sacred treasures used to contain Orochi long ago. His family's treasure is the Kusanagi-no-Tsurugi and his family crest is the sun, represented in a stylized halo of fire. His official nickname is [b]Scion of the Flame[/b].

Some fans always remember Kyo as an eternal school boy, just like when [[Kagura Chizuru|Chizuru]] remembered him as one. This leads to the creation of [[KUSANAGI (Clone)|KUSANAGI]] in [[The King of Fighters 2003|KOF 2003]], and the 2 Kyo clones [[Kyo-1]] and [[Kyo-2]] in [[The King of Fighters '99|KOF '99]].

* !post #640656

* [[Weimao]]
* [[Tag group:Headwear]]

title: weimao
body:
A traditional [[chinese clothes|Chinese]] [[veil]]ed [[hat]]. Predecessor of the Japanese [[ichimegasa]].

Traditionally, it tends to reach shoulder-length only. If the veil is any shorter, it may be a hakka hat instead.

It originates from the more conservative [i]mili[/i], of which would cover a majority of the woman's body. ("image example":[https://www.newhanfu.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/introduce-of-hanfu-face-veil-mili-weimao-2.jpg])

And though the mili was traditionally worn by women, it was also worn by some men in the country of Tuyuhun (now Northwest China), as protection against strong sunlight.

The weimao is different from the humao, which is a [[balaclava]] worn beneath the hat, and was worn by both men and women on horseback.

h4. See also

* [[Honggaitou]] (Chinese red face veil)
* [[futou]]

title: sagitta_(constellation)
body:
Sagitta (the [[Arrow (projectile)|]]) is a small [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It is the third smallest constellation in the sky. The constellation symbolizes an arrow shot by [[Hercules (constellation)|Heracles]] to kill the eagle of Zeus that was sent to gnaw the liver of Prometheus. Its brightest star is [i]Gamma Sagittae[/i].

Sagitta is an easily recognizable constellation. It consists of four connected stars that form the regular letter Y, as opposed to [[Cancer_(constellation)|]], which forms the irregular letter. Since the constellation symbolizes an arrow meant to kill the eagle, it is located right next to the constellation of [[Aquila (constellation)|]].

Not to be confused with [[Sagittarius_(constellation)|]] (the Archer).

h4. Examples

* !asset #21316879
* !post #5491298: Right constellation above the eagle

h4. Neighboring constellations

* [[Aquila (constellation)|]]
* [[Delphinus (constellation)|]]
* [[Hercules (constellation)|]]
* [[Vulpecula (constellation)|]]

h4. External links

* "eSky: Sagitta":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/sagitta.html
* "Wikipedia: Sagitta":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sagitta
* "Study-Style (JP): Sagitta":https://www.study-style.com/seiza/Sge.html

title: gundula_rall
body:
[[Strike Witches]] character.

Gundula Rall is a veteran witch of the [[502nd Joint Fighter Wing]], originating from [[Karlsland]]. Behind [[Gertrud Barkhorn|Barkhorn]] and [[Erica Hartmann|Hartmann]], she is Karlsland Airforce's (and, therefore humanity's) 3rd greatest ace. Her familiar is the [[wolf]].

Strong and confident, Rall takes to her role as commander with relish, acting as more of a brash, frankly-spoken older sister than the more motherly nagging of [[Aleksandra I. Pokryshkin|Pokryshkin]] and nurturing of [[Shimohara Sadako|Shimohara]]. Unlike many in her position, however, she doesn't let herself get too serious, and is laid back and good-humored on a personal level.

Her Ace Archetype is Günther Rall. Like Gundula, he was [[World War II]]'s third highest-scoring ace. 

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Günther Rall":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%BCnther_Rall

title: sanya_v._litvyak
body:
[[Strike Witches]] character.

Aleksandra "Sanya" Vladimirovna Litvyak is a Night Witch of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]], originating from Orussia and affiliated with her home unit: the Imperial Army of Orussia’s 586th Fighter regiment. Her familiar is the domestic cat. Her mild personality and nocturnal lifestyle give her a "ghost like" impression. 

Her Magic Antenna (魔導針, Madō Shin, lit. "Magic Needles") allow her to interact with radio waves. It is a type of non-visual perception that can detect objects at extreme ranges. Also can use a spell to provide guidance cues to other witches and aircraft and is able to tune in and rebroadcast radio transmissions.

Sanya based on Russian flying ace Lydia V. Litvyak, one of only two female aces of [[World War II]] and the only female pilot out of the pilots the witches are based on. Both share the name "White Lily of Stalingrad"; a nickname that may have been influential on the color choice of Sanya's hair. 

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Lydia V. Litvyak":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lydia_Litvyak

title: gugure!_kokkuri-san
body:
Manga series by "Endou Midori":[https://twitter.com/midoroendo]. Its anime adaptation started airing in Fall 2014. Its abbreviated name is Gugukoku.

Ichimatsu Kohina is an elementary school girl who proclaims herself a living doll, explaining her lack of outward emotions.  She lives alone and has no friends, so when she plays [[Kokkuri-san (game)|]] (a spirit-summoning game like an [[ouija]] board) and invites Kokkuri-san to haunt her, an actual fox-eared person arrives and is shocked by her lifestyle.  Kokkuri-san winds up "haunting" her out of pity and concern to get her to stop living a life of avoiding people and eating nothing but cup noodles.

title: hercules_(constellation)
body:
Hercules is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. Its name is the Latin form of the Greek mythological hero Heracles. Its brightest star is Kornephoros.

Hercules has three most common shapes. The first resembles a [[flexing]] stick figure, appearing upside down relative to the neighboring constellations. The second resembles a stick figure with a club raised above its head. The third is a quadrilateral, called the "[i]"Keystone":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/keystone.html[/i]" asterism, with four bent limbs.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21223817
* !asset #21223818: The "Keystone" is highlighted
* !asset #21223815: The "Keystone" is highlighted

title: dogwood_(flower)
body:
[i][b]Cornus[/b][/i], commonly known as dogwood, is a genus of about 30–60 species of woody plants in the family [i]Cornaceae[/i].

Dogwood represents a four-petaled flower with a characteristic center, but just like the [[poinsettia]], the four petals are bracts (specialized leaves) that surround the actual inconspicuous flowers in the center. 

Two of the most commonly depicted species are [i]Cornus florida (hanamizuki)[/i] and [i]Cornus kousa (yamaboushi)[/i]. The former has rounded, notched bract "petals" while the latter has pointed ones.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21123232: [i]Cornus florida[/i]
* !post #3063799: [i]Cornus florida[/i]
* !asset #21123251: [i]Cornus kousa[/i]
* !post #6369753: [i]Cornus kousa[/i]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cornus florida":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cornus_florida

title: sandersonia_(flower)
body:
A flower genus native to South Africa. The sole member of the genus is called [i]Sandersonia aurantiaca[/i].

Sandersonia has [[yellow flower|yellow]] to [[orange flower|orange]] bell- or lantern-shaped flowers that hang from a central stem with thin, lance-shaped leaves. Because of its resemblance to [[lily of the valley]], it is commonly known as [b]golden lily of the valley[/b]. Other common names include [b]Chinese lantern lily[/b] and [b]Christmas bells[/b].

h4. Examples

title: epiphyllum
body:
A genus of flowering [[cactus|cacti]]. Its [[flower]]s are famous for blooming at night instead of during the day. Some species, such as [i]Epiphyllum oxypetalum[/i], bloom for only one night and wilt in the morning. Nowadays there are also day-blooming hybrids.

Epiphyllum represents a layered flower with thin, long outer petals and thicker, shorter inner petals. Common epiphyllums are white, but hybrids can also be orange, pink, red and yellow. Common names include [b]climbing cactus[/b], [b]Dutchman's pipe cactus[/b], [b][[orchid]]  cactus[/b] and [b]queen of the night[/b].

Its Japanese name 月下美人 [i](gekka-bijin)[/i] literally translates to "beauty under the moon". The one-night bloom of [i]Epiphyllum oxypetalum[/i] is often used as a metaphor for the transience of beauty.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21164593
* !post #1273907
* !post #1674604
* !post #2629389

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Epiphyllum":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epiphyllum
* "Wikipedia: Epiphyllum oxypetalum":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epiphyllum_oxypetalum
* "Wikipedia: Epiphyllum hybrid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epiphyllum_hybrid
* "Wikipedia: Cactaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cactus

title: rose_of_sharon
body:
[i]Hibiscus syriacus[/i] is a species of [[hibiscus]] in the [i]Malvaceae[/i] family. Other names include [b]Syrian ketmia[/b], [b]shurb althea[/b], [b]rose mallow[/b], [b]mugunghwa[/b] or [b]mokkeunhwa[/b]. It is the national flower of [[South Korea]].

Rose of Sharon bears trumpet- or vase-shaped flowers with five broad petals and a distinctive long pistil. Unlike [i]Hibiscus rosa-sinensis[/i], the stamens of [i]Hibiscus syriacus[/i] surround the pistil from base to tip. Flowers come in shades of pink, red, blue, purple and white. They are often bicolored, with the base of the petals having a different color.

h4. Examples

* "Wikipedia: Malvaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malvaceae

title: big_dipper
body:
An asterism (a group of bright [[star (sky)|]]s forming a pattern) consisting of seven bright stars of the [[constellation]] [[Ursa Major (constellation)|]], recognized by its shape, which resembles a ladle or pot with a handle, hence the name. Also called the [i]Plough[/i] and in China and Japan the [i]North Dipper[/i] (北斗), which contrasts with the traditional Chinese constellation called the "[i]South Dipper[/i]":https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Sagittarius_with_Chinese_Asterisms_and_Mansions.svg (南斗), a six-star part of the [[Sagittarius_(constellation)|]] constellation. It is also referred to simply as the "North Star" in several countries.

The Big Dipper can be distinguished from [[Ursa Minor (constellation)|]], also known as the [i]Little Dipper[/i], by its "handle": the former is bent downward, while the latter is bent upward.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21150856: Shape
* !post #530127
* !post #5037221: Sometimes the "handle" is depicted more curved

h4. See also

* [[Hokuto no Ken]]
* [[Ursa Minor (constellation)|]]

h4. External links 

* "Wikipedia: Big Dipper":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Dipper
* "Wikipedia (CH): South Dipper":https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/南斗六星
* "Encyclopedia Britannica: Asterism":https://www.britannica.com/science/asterism-astronomy

title: lupus_(constellation)
body:
Lupus (the [[Wolf]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest star is Kakkab, also known as Men.

Lupus represents a stick figure of an animal with a triangular head and no tail, as opposed to [[Canis Major (constellation)|]], which has a tail. The constellation lies directly to the left of [[Centaurus (constellation)|]] and is often interpreted as an animal that has been killed or is about to be killed.

Not to be confused with [[Lepus_(constellation)|]] (the Hare).

title: canis_major_(constellation)
body:
Canis Major (the Greater [[Dog]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its name, the [i]Greater Dog[/i], refers to and contrasts it with nearby [[Canis Minor (constellation)|]], the [i]Lesser Dog[/i]. Its brightest star is [[Sirius (star)|]], part of the "Winter Triangle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Triangle and the brightest star in the sky other than the [[Sun]].

Canis Major represents a stick figure of an animal with a long, slender body and a triangular head. It has somewhat similar features to [[Lupus (constellation)|]], but can be distinguished by its "tail": Canis Major has it, while Lupus doesn't.

title: ophiuchus_(constellation)
body:
Ophiuchus (the Serpent Bearer or Snake Holder) is a [[constellation]] located on the celestial equator. It is also the thirteenth constellation that crosses the ecliptic, like the twelve constellations of the [[zodiac]]. Because of this, Ophiuchus is sometimes referred to as the [[Ophiuchus (zodiac)|thirteenth sign]] of the zodiac. It is "wedged" between [[Scorpius (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]] to the east. The constellation is often associated with Asclepius in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is Rasalhague.

Ophiuchus the Serpent Bearer is virtually inseparable from [[Serpens (constellation)|]] the Serpent, so it is rarely depicted as a stand-alone constellation. It represents a stick figure with a large body holding a snake, represented by lines extending for both sides. Therefore, the snake itself is divided into two parts: Serpens Caput (head) to the west and Serpens Cauda (tail) to the east. The east and west of the celestial sphere are mirrored because the sphere is observed from the inside.

h4. Examples

title: serpens_(constellation)
body:
Serpens (the Serpent or [[Snake]]) is a [[constellation]] located on the celestial equator. It is the only official constellation that is divided into two parts: Serpens Cauda (the Serpent's Tail) and Serpens Caput (the Serpent's Head). Its brightest star is Unukalhai, located in Serpens Caput.

Serpens the Serpent is virtually inseparable from [[Ophiuchus (constellation)|]] the Serpent Bearer, so it is rarely depicted as a stand-alone constellation, although Serpens Caput is sometimes depicted separately. It is represented by the two groups of straight lines extending from either side of Ophiuchus. The eastern part (to the left) is Serpens Cauda, represented by straight lines only, and the western part (to the right) is Serpens Caput, represented by several straight lines ending in a triangle. The east and west of the celestial sphere are mirrored because the sphere is observed from the inside.

h4. Examples

title: capricorn_(constellation)
body:
Capricornus (the Horned [[Goat]]) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere, between [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Aquarius (constellation)|]] to the east. Although "Capricornus" means the "horned goat" or "goat horn", it symbolizes a mythological sea goat that is half goat, half fish. It is the smallest constellation of the zodiac. Its brightest star is Deneb Algedi.

Capricornus resembles an arrowhead or a pointed letter D.

title: aquila_(constellation)
body:
Aquila (the [[Eagle]]) is a [[constellation]] located on the Celestial equator. It symbolizes the "eagle of Zeus/Jupiter":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eagle_of_Zeus. Its brightest star is [[Altair (star)|]], part of the "Summer Triangle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Triangle.

title: kamchatka_lily
body:
A species of [[flower]]ing plant of the genus [i]Fritillaria[/i] in the family [i]Liliaceae[/i], native to northeastern Asia and northwestern North America. Common names include [b]Black lily[/b], [b]Chocolate lily[/b], [b]Kamchatka lily[/b], and [b]Rice lily[/b].

Kamchatka lilies bear nodding, bell-shaped flowers that somewhat resemble tulips. The flowers are six-petaled and colored in shades of purple, reddish brown, or black, occasionally spotted or streaked. One of the distinctive features of the Kamchatka lily is its green pistil, which is divided into three sections, each with a relatively long tip. This feature helps to distinguish Kamchatka lilies from [[lily (flower)|true lilies]] and [[tulip]]s. The leaves are lance-shaped.

Note that its Japanese name, クロユリ (黒百合 [i]kuro-yuri[/i], lit. black lily), can be used for both fritillarias and black colored [[lily (flower)|lilies]] (genus Lilium). Pay attention to the flower details.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22215605: Photo reference, flower and its pistil (green)
* !post #3002923
* !post #5502638

body:

If it's smaller in size than the top of a table consider [[cloth]] instead.

title: lily_(flower)
body:
A [[flower]] of the genus [i]Lilium[/i] in the family [i]Liliaceae[/i].

Lily flowers have 6 petals (technically 3 petals and 3 sepals) and come in a variety of shapes such as bell, flat, funnel, recurved, trumpet, etc. They can be almost any color, but [[white lily|white lilies]] are probably the most well-known kind, being either [i]Lilium candidum[/i] (Madonna Lilies) or [i]Lilium longiflorum[/i] (Easter Lily) with their characteristic trumpet shape.

Lilies are a symbol for Girls Love as well as an eponym for its alternate name [[yuri]] due to their Japanese name "yuri".

h4. Examples 

* !post #1323515: [i]Lilium candidum[/i] 
* !post #1333457: [i]Lilium longiflorum[/i] 
* !post #1080404: Lilies as yuri moment decoration

title: false_smile
body:
When a character is smiling on the outside, but their actions, situation or dialogue imply that they are anything but happy. This usually occurs during moments of shock, the bitter tension between enemies, or the proverbial calm before the storm just before they snap.

This tag is not for hysterical laughter, [[evil grin]]s, angry [[glaring|glares]], or [[yandere]].

title: accordion
body:
An accordion is a bellow-driven [[instrument]]. It usually has a rectangular bellow and asymmetrical sides with keys sticking out on one side.

If the sides look symmetrical and the bellow is square, hexagonal or octagonal, it’s probably a [[concertina]] instead.

title: kariginu
body:
A type of [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]].

A notable feature are the sleeves: they are not sewn to the body of the clothing, giving a distinct [[shoulder cutout|open slit on the shoulders]].

Originally designed as hunting clothes, they were comfortable enough that they became common informal clothing for the nobility during the Heian period and onwards.

Please note that this tag does not distinguish between actual kariginu, suikan and other similar clothes, encompassing all of them.

h4. Examples

* !post #7323281
* !post #7549467

title: takenouchi_sora
body:
One of the main characters from the anime [[Digimon Adventure]] and [[Digimon Adventure tri.]], and one of the supporting characters in [[Digimon Adventure 02]].

Sora is partnered with [[Piyomon]] and is the bearer of the Crest of Love.

When she was a child, she was very tomboyish, being the only girl in the school's soccer team, where she was the teammate of [[Yagami Taichi]] and [[Izumi Koshiro]]. A caring person, she was very protective of the group, and acted almost as a motherly figure, especially to [[Tachikawa Mimi]] and [[Takaishi Takeru]]. She often acted as a voice of reason to the others, especially during Taichi and Ishida Yamato's arguments.

h4. Appearance

* !post #732868: [[Digimon Adventure]]

title: morning_glory
body:
A common name for more than 1000 species of [[flower]]ing plants in the [i]Convolvulaceae[/i] family.

The [[plant]] bears funnel-shaped flowers that close late in the day. They are known for their five symmetrical, finely overlapping petals and bright colors in shades of pink, red, blue, and purple; the center is often white. The flowers often have a distinctive star shape in the center, which is often emphasized by artists. Depending on the species, the leaves can be heart-shaped or ivy-shaped (three-lobed). Morning glory [[vines]] are often trained to climb [[trellis]]es but will eagerly climb [[fence]]s as well.

As morning glories are easy to grow, Japanese elementary schools often have their students grow them as part of their plant cultivation experience. It is typical summer homework for Japanese students to bring home the morning glories (that they have grown to a certain extent at school) and observe and record their growth (note that summer vacation is in the middle of the school year in Japan).

Its common Japanese name, アサガオ (朝顔 [i]asa-gao[/i]), literally translates to "morning face". There is a night-blooming species, [i]Ipomoea alba[/i], commonly called [[moonflower (flower)|]]. Its common Japanese name is ヨルガオ (夜顔 [i]yoru-gao[/i]), which literally translates to "night face".

h4. Examples

* !post #6225060
* !post #6882035
* !post #7919920: Morning glories on trellis
* !post #4801789: [[Moonflower (flower)|]]

h4. See also
